{{Infobox company | name = Actua Corporation | logo = Actua logo.png | industry = [[Business-to-business]] | traded_as = {{NASDAQ was|ACTA}} | fate = Underwent [[liquidation]] | foundation = {{start date and age|1996|03|04}} | founder = [[Ken Fox]]
[[Walter Buckley (businessman)|Walter Buckley]] | defunct = {{end date and age|2018|04|18}} | location = [[Radnor, Pennsylvania]] | homepage = {{URL|http://www.actua.com}} }} '''Actua Corporation''' was a [[venture capital]] firm. During the [[dot com bubble]], the company had a [[market capitalization]] of over $50 billion. The company was originally known as Internet Capital Group, Inc. and changed its name to Actua Corporation in September 2014. In 2018, the company underwent [[liquidation]].{{cite web | url=https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1085621/000119312518122202/d573879d8k.htm | title=Actua 8-K | publisher=[[U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission]] | date=April 18, 2018}} ==History== === Incubator === In March 1996, [[Ken Fox]] and [[Walter Buckley (businessman)|Walter Buckley]] left Safeguard Scientifics to form Internet Capital Group (ICG), a [[venture capital]] firm focused on [[business-to-business]] e-commerce. They asked Safeguard Scientifics CEO [[Pete Musser]] for $5 million in funding, but he insisted on investing $15 million. In total, Buckley and Fox raised $40 million to start ICG, twice what they wanted. In addition to Safeguard Scientifics, major investors included [[Comcast]], [[Compaq]], BancBoston Ventures, and a dozen individuals.{{cite news | url=http://archive.fortune.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/2001/09/17/310278/index.htm | title=Following The Money Some 680 men, women, techies, and, yes, schools got pre-IPO shares of Internet highflier ICG. Here's how they became insiders and what they did as the stock crashed. | first=Andy | last=Serwer | work=[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]] | date=September 17, 2001}} Initially, the company was organized as a [[limited-liability company]]. Following the "[[keiretsu]]" model used by Safeguard Scientifics, the company was heavily involved in the operations of the companies in which it invested and the start-ups would do business with each other, increasing the value of all parties. Its annual meetings were opportunities for CEOs of partner companies to share their experiences and cut new deals. One member CEO called it "a perfect way to manage chaos." The work environment was casual, or as one partner company CEO called it, "almost like a fraternity". One of ICG's first investments was a website called Water Online. Under the guidance of ICG, in late 1997, Water Online hired [[Mark Walsh (businessman)|Mark Walsh]], head of AOL's B2B division, as CEO. The company changed its name to [[VerticalNet]], expanded into 47 different industries, and became one of the first B2B companies to become a [[public company]], albeit with limited revenue. Spurning opportunities to invest in online [[retail]]ers such as [[CDNow]] and [[AutoWeb]], ICG developed a reputation as "the VCs to see if you were an entrepreneur with a B2B idea." In July 1998, [[GE Capital]] invested in the company in a financing round that generated $70 million. Early investments began to pay off and ICG generated additional funds by selling some of its positions. However, unlike traditional venture capitalists, Buckley and Fox envisioned that ICG would hold most of its investments for ten years or longer. The duo were ambitious, aiming to have a stake in 80% of the B2B market. In the fall of 1998, to support this goal, the company aggressively hired top talent from companies such as [[Microsoft]], [[McKinsey & Co.]], [[General Electric]], [[Cambridge Technology Partners]], [[Heidrick & Struggles]], and [[Softbank]]. After much effort, Fox persuaded Sam Jadallah, Microsoft's chief of enterprise sales and marketing, to join the company. In February 1999, the company converted to a [[C corporation]]. In May, $90 million of additional funding was raised via a [[convertible bond]] issue. === Public Company === In August 1999, the company became a [[public company]] via an [[initial public offering]], offering 14.9 million shares at $12 per share. The company sold another 7.5 million shares to [[IBM]], generating more than $200 million. [[Dell Computer]] bought 1 million of the shares in the IPO. High-profile investors now included [[Amerindo Investment Advisors]], the [[House of Saud]], the [[Penske]] family, and [[David Bonderman]]. Safeguard Scientifics was the largest stakeholder.{{cite news | url=http://archive.fortune.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/1999/09/27/266165/index.htm | title=A One-Stock Way to Play The Net Here's an exclusive first look at the company analysts think is best poised to capitalize on the Net's next big wave: business-to-business e-commerce. Internet Capital has stakes in 36 hot B2B startups. | first=Erick | last=Schonfeld | work=[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]] | date=September 27, 1999}} At the time of the IPO, ICG held stakes in 35 companies.{{cite news | url=http://news.cnet.com/IPO-Roundup-Internet-Capital-Group-flies-in-debut,-Mission-Critical-also-gains/2100-12_3-265295.html | title=IPO Roundup: Internet Capital Group flies in debut, Mission Critical also gains | work=[[CNET]] | date=August 5, 1999}} About half the businesses aimed to create either an [[online marketplace]] or [[online community]], while the other half were engaged in [[software development]]. The stock doubled in price on its first day, and hit $50 per share in October 1999. Book value of the company, including stakes in VerticalNet and U.S. Interactive which had gone public, was only about $1 billion and Wall Street was betting on future success. By December 1999, the stock was trading at over $200 per share. Buckley's stake of 10 million shares, or 3.5% of the company and Fox's stake of 12 million shares, or 4.5% of the company, were each worth over $2 billion.{{cite news | url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB979079311344158702 | title=1. IPOs Will Make You Rich | first=Ruth | last=Simon | work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] | date=January 29, 2001}}{{subscription required}} The company was valued at nearly $60 billion, making it the 3rd largest Internet company by market capitalization behind [[AOL]] and [[Yahoo!]]. By then, the company had invested $300 million in 39 start-ups and had a staff of 29 people to manage and advise those companies. Operations were split into two locations with Buckley serving as CEO and working out of the Philadelphia area, while Fox managed West Coast operations in [[San Francisco]]. Three executives were hired in November to head a new European team.{{cite news | url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/1999-10-31/internet-capitals-young-turks | title=Internet Capital's Young Turks | first=Amy | last=Barrett | work=[[Bloomberg L.P.]] | date=November 1, 1999}}{{subscription required}} In December 1999, the company raised over $1 billion in additional capital.{{cite news | url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB945380302947799267 | title=Internet Capital Group Announces Massive Stock and Debt Offerings | work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] | date=December 16, 1999}}{{subscription required}} During its first 9 months as a corporation, it realized only $14.8 million of revenue and lost $6.4 million. In 1998, it recorded a profit of $14 million on $3 million of revenue, with the profits coming from sales of companies. By February 1, 2000, the stock had declined nearly $100 per share in anticipation of insider selling at the expiration of the [[lock-up period]]. However, retail investors bought up insider shares, stabilizing the price. Meanwhile, the company continued to expand its investments. By early 2000, the company had invested $1.4 billion in 61 start-up firms, and was forging new partnerships with old economy leaders.{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2000-05-15/walter-buckley-iii | title=Walter Buckley III | first=Amy | last=Barrett | work=[[Bloomberg L.P.]] | date=May 15, 2000}} The rapid expansion was motivated by what Fox called "the biggest wealth-creation opportunity the world has ever seen" – finding the promising e-commerce B2B companies before anyone else. The [[NASDAQ Composite]] [[stock market index]] peaked in March 2000 and the company was hurt by the bursting of the [[dot-com bubble]]. By April 2000, its stock was down to $40 a share and GE Capital filed to sell nearly 1 million shares. By June 2000, the stock was down to $30 per share. Buckley, who sold very little of his own stock, remained optimistic. By November 2000, the stock was down to $11 per share{{cite news | url=http://money.cnn.com/2000/11/09/technology/overview/ | title=The $1.7 trillion dot.com lesson | work=[[CNNMoney]] | date=November 9, 2000}} and after the [[September 11 attacks]] it traded for 70 cents per share. Two years after its peak in March 2000, the company had a [[market capitalization]] of $200 million, down 99.5%.{{cite news | url=https://insurancenewsnet.com/oarticle/Actua-New-name-for-a-company-with-fresh-hopes-a-551806 | title=Actua: New name for a company with fresh hopes | first=Joseph N. | last=DiStefano | work=[[The Philadelphia Inquirer]] | date=September 6, 2014}} The company survived the crash, and changed its business model. Instead of taking small stakes in many companies, it invested in a few "core" companies at a time, usually as majority owner. This allowed the company to have much greater control over the operations of its investments. Buckley refocused the company to find strategic partnerships with traditional industry leaders such as a joint venture with [[DuPont]] called CapSpan in early 2000. ICG sold Logistics.com to [[Manhattan Associates]]{{Cite news|url=https://www.sdcexec.com/home/press-release/10310040/manhattan-associates-acquires-logisticscom|title=Manhattan Associates Acquires Logistics.com|work=Supply & Demand Chain Executive|access-date=2018-11-12|language=en}} for $20 million in 2003. === Winding down === In February 2013, the company sold its stake in Channel Intelligence to [[Google]] for $60 million in proceeds.{{cite news | url=https://techcrunch.com/2013/02/06/google-acquires-channel-intelligence-to-boost-product-recommendations-and-e-commer-with-users/ | title=Google Acquires Channel Intelligence for $125 Million | first=Ingrid | last=Lundgren | work=[[TechCrunch]] | date=February 6, 2013}} In December 2013, the company sold Procurian to [[Accenture]] for $375 million.{{cite press release | url=https://globenewswire.com/news-release/2013/12/05/594818/10060497/en/ICG-Group-Announces-Completion-of-Sale-of-Procurian-to-Accenture-for-375-Million.html | title=ICG Group Announces Completion of Sale of Procurian to Accenture for $375 Million | publisher=[[Globe Newswire]] | date=December 5, 2013}} In September 2014, when the company changed its name to Actua Corporation, its stock was trading around $20 per share and was worth approximately $700 million. In October 2016, the company sold [[Govdelivery]] to [[Vista Equity Partners]] for $153 million.{{cite press release | url=https://globenewswire.com/news-release/2016/10/19/880875/0/en/Actua-Announces-Completion-of-Sale-of-GovDelivery-to-Investor-Group-Led-By-Vista-Equity-Partners-for-153-Million-in-Cash.html | title=Actua Announces Completion of Sale of GovDelivery to Investor Group Led By Vista Equity Partners for $153 Million in Cash | publisher=[[Globe Newswire]] | date=October 19, 2016}} In December 2017, the company sold its interests in VelocityEHS and Bolt Solutions for $328 million.{{cite press release | url=https://globenewswire.com/news-release/2017/12/12/1253425/0/en/Actua-Announces-Successful-Completion-of-Sale-of-VelocityEHS-and-Bolt-Solutions.html | title=Actua Announces Successful Completion of Sale of VelocityEHS and Bolt Solutions | publisher=[[Globe Newswire]] | date=December 12, 2017}} In January 2018, the company sold FolioDynamix for net proceeds of $166.3 million.{{cite press release | url=https://globenewswire.com/news-release/2018/01/02/1277273/0/en/Actua-Announces-Completion-of-Sale-of-FolioDynamix.html | title=Actua Announces Completion of Sale of FolioDynamix | publisher=[[Globe Newswire]] | date=January 2, 2018}} In 2018, the company underwent [[liquidation]]. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} [[Category:1996 establishments in Pennsylvania]] [[Category:1999 initial public offerings]] [[Category:Companies based in Philadelphia]] [[Category:Companies formerly listed on NASDAQ]] [[Category:Dot-com bubble]] [[Category:E-commerce]] [[Category:Venture capital firms of the United States]] [[Category:Financial services companies established in 1996]] [[Category:Financial services companies disestablished in 2018]]

Oct.),[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/23/89-%D9%82%D8%B6%D9%88%D8%A7-%D8%A3%D9%85%D8%B3-%D8%A8%D9%8A%D9%86%D9%87%D9%85-21-%D8%B9%D9%86%D8%B5%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%8B-%D9%85%D9%86-%D9%82%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%B8%D8%A7%D9%85-%D9%88/] 4 killed (23 Oct.)[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/24/95-%D9%82%D8%B6%D9%88%D8%A7-%D8%A3%D9%85%D8%B3-%D8%A8%D9%8A%D9%86%D9%87%D9%85-30-%D8%B9%D9%86%D8%B5%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%8B-%D9%85%D9%86-%D9%82%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%B8%D8%A7%D9%85-%D9%88/] 3 killed (24 0ct.),[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=53218] total of 98–141 reported killed |casualties2= 56–96+ killed2 killed (28 8 killed (30 Sep.),[https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUSKCN1200Q9] 1 killed (2 7 killed (7 Oct.),[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/08/113-%D9%82%D8%B6%D9%88%D8%A7-%D8%A3%D9%85%D8%B3-%D8%A8%D9%8A%D9%86%D9%87%D9%85-29-%D9%85%D9%86-%D8%B9%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%B5%D8%B1-%D9%82%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%B8%D8%A7%D9%85-%D9%88%D8%A7/] 9 killed (9 Oct.),[http://www.insidesourcenews.com/single-post/2016/10/10/Rebels-Fight-Back-In-Aleppo-City] 2 killed (11 Oct.),[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/13/118-%D9%82%D8%B6%D9%88%D8%A7-%D8%A3%D9%85%D8%B3-%D8%A8%D9%8A%D9%86%D9%87%D9%85-18-%D9%85%D9%86-%D8%B9%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%B5%D8%B1-%D9%82%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%B8%D8%A7%D9%85-%D9%88-2/] 1 killed (13 Oct.),[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/14/90-%D9%82%D8%B6%D9%88%D8%A7-%D8%A3%D9%85%D8%B3-%D8%A8%D9%8A%D9%86%D9%87%D9%85-24-%D9%85%D9%86-%D8%B9%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%B5%D8%B1-%D9%82%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%B8%D8%A7%D9%85-%D9%88%D8%A7/] 2–42 killed (15 Oct.),[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/16/82-%D9%82%D8%B6%D9%88%D8%A7-%D8%A3%D9%85%D8%B3-%D8%A8%D9%8A%D9%86%D9%87%D9%85-25-%D9%85%D9%86-%D8%B9%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%B5%D8%B1-%D9%82%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%B8%D8%A7%D9%85-%D9%88%D8%A7/] [https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/battle-aleppo-rages-syrian-army-advances-map-update/] 11 killed (16 Oct.),[https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/787763132298952704] 2 killed (17 Oct.),[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=52644] total of 56–96 reported killed |casualties3= 573 civilians killed (per the [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights|SOHR]]; since 19 Sep.)[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=52683 After More than 2700 civilian casualties and injuries in Aleppo Province, 30 hours of no-bombing over the eastern neighborhoods]
497 civilians killed (per the [[United Nations|UN]]){{cite web|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUKKBN12E1XZ?il=0|title=Aleppo rebels outgunned but confident as siege bites|date=14 October 2016|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=14 October 2016}} | campaignbox = {{Campaignbox Syrian Civil War}}{{Campaignbox Battle of Aleppo}} }} The '''Aleppo offensive of September–October 2016''' was the military operation launched in [[Aleppo]] in late September 2016 by the [[Syrian Army]] and its allies aiming to capture all of the remaining rebel-held parts of the city of Aleppo. Rebel forces controlling East Aleppo at that time were primarily fighters of [[Fatah Halab]]{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/28/world/middleeast/aleppo-syria-ground-offensive.html|title=Syrian Troops Clash With Rebels as Bombs Fall on Aleppo|last=Saad|first=Hwaida |date=27 September 2016|newspaper=The New York Times|issn=0362-4331|access-date=30 September 2016}} (which includes [[Free Syrian Army|FSA]] units),{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/28/world/middleeast/aleppo-syria-ground-offensive.html|title=Syrian Troops Clash With Rebels as Bombs Fall on Aleppo|last=Saad|first=Hwaida |date=27 September 2016|newspaper=The New York Times|issn=0362-4331|access-date=7 November 2016}} although a significant number of [[Jabhat Fateh al-Sham]] and [[Ahrar al-Sham]] fighters were also present.{{cite web|url=http://www.middleeasteye.net/columns/wrong-un-s-syria-envoy-offer-aleppo-18894725|title=UN Syria envoy's offer could hand Aleppo to Assad|work=Middle East Eye|date=11 October 2016|quote=If we agreed on evacuating Jabhat Fateh al-Sham from Aleppo today, the regime will demand the evacuation of Ahrar al-Sham tomorrow and the rest of the groups later on}} ==Offensive== ===Airstrikes and initial fighting=== [[File:15alep.png|thumb|left|Map of the offensive]] Early on 22 September 2016, the Syrian and Russian Air Forces started preparatory air-strikes for the upcoming offensive. Over 40 air-strikes were conducted against five districts throughout the day.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-jets-pound-east-aleppo-ahead-upcoming-offensive/ |author=News Desk|work=Al-Masdar News|title=Syrian jets pound east Aleppo ahead of upcoming offensive|accessdate=23 September 2016}}{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/sep/22/syria-army-new-aleppo-offensive-ceasefire |title=Aleppo enters second day of bombing in new Syrian army offensive |work=The Guardian |accessdate=23 September 2016}} Mobilization of ground units had also started and by the evening of that day, the ground assault against the rebel-held eastern part of Aleppo city was about to begin.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-begin-important-east-aleppo-offensive/|title=Syrian Army to begin important east Aleppo offensive|work=Al-Masdar News|author=Leith Fadel|date=22 September 2016|accessdate=23 September 2016}} At this time, the military officially announced the start of the offensive.{{cite web|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20160923-syria-aleppo-offensive-diplomats-fail-revive-truce-assad |publisher=France 24|title=Syria launches Aleppo offensive as diplomats fail to revive truce |accessdate=23 September 2016}} The strikes continued for a second day into 23 September, and the explosions were described as "the fiercest the city had faced". Buildings were demolished, a main water station was damaged{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-3803638/Intense-bombing-campaign-targets-Syria-civil-defense-centers.html |title=Bombing campaign in Syria kills dozens, demolishes buildings|work=Daily Mail|accessdate=24 September 2016}} and neighborhoods were engulfed in flames.{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/world/1093873/%E2%80%98doomsday-today-in-aleppo|title=‘Doomsday today in Aleppo’|work=Bangkok Post|accessdate=24 September 2016}} Since the start of the bombing campaign, 50 Russian air-strikes had been conducted on the city and 30 in the surrounding areas,{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/09/23/russian-planes-bomb-aleppo-syrian-army-begins-assault/90898328/ |work=USA Today|title=Russian planes bomb Aleppo as Syrian army begins assault|accessdate=23 September 2016}} in addition to dozens carried out by the Syrian Air Force.[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=51030 Heavy Russian aerial bombardment continue targeting rebels controlled areas of Aleppo] During the day, the first Army ground advances took place in the southern outskirts of Aleppo,[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=51049 27 casualties in massacres carried out by Russian warplanes and helicopters in Aleppo city] as the military secured the Ramousah-'Amiriyah highway and its intersection after gains around the Al-Badawi mosque.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-advances-aleppo-launch-offensive/ |author=Izat Charkatli|work=Al-Masdar News|title=Syrian Army advances in Aleppo after launch of offensive|accessdate=23 September 2016}}[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/09/24/%D8%B9%D8%AF%D8%A9-%D9%85%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%88%D8%B1-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%AF%D9%8A%D9%86%D8%A9-%D8%AD%D9%84%D8%A8-%D9%88%D8%A3%D8%B7%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%81%D9%87%D8%A7-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AC%D9%86%D9%88%D8%A8/ عدة محاور في مدينة حلب وأطرافها الجنوبية والشمالية تشهد اشتباكات وقصف وقذائف يستهدفان المدينة] The government advances forced civilians from the area to migrate to other parts of eastern Aleppo. Later, pro-government Palestinian militias also captured parts of the Handarat Camp area of northeastern Aleppo, namely the Shaher district.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/liwaa-al-quds-syrian-army-seize-large-parts-handarat-camp-northern-aleppo/|title=Liwaa Al-Quds, Syrian Army seize large parts of Handarat Camp in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=24 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=26 September 2016}} The Handarat Camp had been previously a Palestinian refugee camp.{{cite web |url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/09/24/latest-government-forces-gain-ground-near-aleppo.html|title=The Latest: Government Forces Gain Ground Near Aleppo|date=24 September 2016|publisher=Fox News|accessdate=26 September 2016}} By the end of the day, the Syrian Air Force had conducted more than 150 air-strikes against 30 neighbourhoods in Aleppo. Army artillery bombardment was also conducted.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/09/scores-killed-syrian-jets-pound-rebel-held-aleppo-160923134637232.html|title=Scores killed as Syrian jets pound rebel-held Aleppo |publisher=Al Jazeera|accessdate=24 September 2016}} Early on 24 September, military preparations were being made for the Syrian Army to assault the southern Sheikh Sa'id district.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-hezbollah-storm-southern-aleppo-districts/|title=Syrian Army, Hezbollah storm southern Aleppo districts|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=24 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=24 September 2016}} The attack started that morning, and within hours government troops had taken control of several building blocks.{{cite web|url=http://www.insidesourcenews.com/single-post/2016/09/24/SAA-Begins-Storming-East-Aleppo|title=SAA Begins Storming East Aleppo!|publisher=The Inside Source|accessdate=24 September 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160926063150/http://www.insidesourcenews.com/single-post/2016/09/24/SAA-Begins-Storming-East-Aleppo|archive-date=26 September 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-attacks-key-district-southern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army attacks key district in southern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=24 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=26 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/syriahroe/posts/951878568253815|title=Syrian Observatory for Human Rights – Timeline – Facebook|publisher=|accessdate=26 September 2016}} Concurrently, pro-government militias continued to advance in the Handarat Camp area,{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/syriahroe/posts/951762578265414|title=Aerial bombardment kills 7 in Aleppo|publisher=|accessdate=24 September 2016}} seizing the eastern entrance to the Camp and leaving only half of it still rebel-held. Shortly after, the Palestinian militias captured the whole Handarat Camp.{{cite web|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-mideast-crisis-syria-raids-idUKKCN11U05F|title=U.S., Russia trade blows over Syria as warplanes pound Aleppo|first=Michelle Nichols and Suleiman|last=Al-Khalidi|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=26 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/syrian-civil-war-aleppo-bombing-civilians-killed-water-crisis-third-day-advance-assad-putin-russia-a7327351.html|title=Third day of ‘horrific’ Aleppo air strikes kills dozens of civilians|date=24 September 2016|work=The Independent|accessdate=26 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/official-liwaa-al-quds-syrian-army-capture-handarat-camp-northern-aleppo/|title=[Official] Liwaa Al-Quds, Syrian Army capture Handarat Camp in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=24 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=26 September 2016}} In addition, government troops made advances on a third axis, taking control of two dozen building blocks near the historic [[Citadel of Aleppo|Aleppo citadel]] in the city center. Meanwhile, a new wave of air-strikes were conducted throughout Aleppo, and a military official stated the strikes had been targeting an array of rebel fortifications, including tunnels, bunkers and command centers.{{cite web|url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/warplanes-mount-strikes-rebel-held-aleppo-071453031.html|title=Warplanes press attack on rebel-held eastern Aleppo|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=24 September 2016}} Following the capture of the Handarat Camp district, the Army shifted its focus to the nearby Kindi Cancer Hospital, which had been converted into a military base by the rebels.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-palestinian-committees-attack-kindi-hospital-northern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army, Palestinian committees attack Kindi Hospital in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=24 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=26 September 2016}} Intense clashes took place at the hospital, as the Army also imposed fire control over the nearby Shuqeif Industrial Area.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/map-syrian-army-makes-significant-progress-northern-aleppo/|title=[Map] Syrian Army makes significant progress in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=24 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=26 September 2016}} Later that evening, an initial rebel counter-attack against the Handarat Camp was repelled.{{cite web|title=Syrian Army, Quds Brigade repel jihadist assault on Handarat Camp|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-quds-brigade-repel-jihadist-assault-handarat-camp/|website=Al-Masdar|accessdate=24 September 2016}} However, pro-government militias withdrew from the district, while still maintaining control of the nearby Shaher sector and the Handarat Industrial District, east of the refugee camp.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-quds-brigade-withdraw-handarat-camp/|title=Syrian Army, Quds Brigade withdraw from Handarat Camp|first=Izat|last=Charkatli|date=24 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=26 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/09/25/syrian-rebels-reverse-government-gains-in-aleppo-stalemate.html|title=At Least 23 Civilians Killed In Aleppo As Un Holds Emergency Meeting Over Syria|date=25 September 2016|publisher=Fox News |accessdate=26 September 2016}} On 25 September, after securing the Shaher district, the Palestinian militias launched a new assault on the Handarat Camp.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/liwaa-al-quds-syrian-army-storm-handarat-camp-northern-aleppo/|title=Liwaa Al-Quds, Syrian Army storm Handarat Camp in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=25 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=26 September 2016}} The camp was heavily hit by air-strikes. The bombing burned many rebel vehicles. Fighting also continued in the southern Sheikh Sa'id district,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-hezbollah-attack-strategic-district-southern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army, Hezbollah attack strategic district in southern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=25 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=26 September 2016}} where the Army was reportedly in control of 25–30 percent of the area.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/TheInsideSourc/status/779886845177896960|title=The Inside Source on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=26 September 2016}} ===Syrian Army advances in northern and central Aleppo=== On 27 September, the Army advanced in the Farafira district of [[Old Aleppo]]{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/syria-war-aleppo-attack-assad-army-ground-troops-in-city-nato-air-strikes-a7332591.html|title=Syrian army troops advance on Aleppo as Nato calls air strikes 'blatant violation of international law'|date=27 September 2016|work=The Independent|accessdate=27 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/syria-regime-rebel-held-aleppo-airstrikes-civil-war-offensive/|title=After post-cease-fire onslaught, Assad's forces vow to finish job|publisher=BCS News|accessdate=27 September 2016}} and captured it.{{cite web|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20160927-syrian-army-takes-rebel-neighbourhood-aleppo-military-says|title=Syrian army takes rebel neighbourhood in Aleppo, military says |date=27 September 2016|publisher=France 24|accessdate=27 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-hezbollah-capture-farafira-district-east-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army, Hezbollah capture the Farafira District in east Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=27 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=27 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://reliefweb.int/report/syrian-arab-republic/two-largest-hospitals-rebel-held-aleppo-bombed|title=Two largest hospitals in rebel-held Aleppo bombed|date=28 September 2016|publisher=}} At the same time, the two largest hospitals in the rebel-held part of the city were hit by an air-strike and artillery fire. The next day, the military slightly advanced in the al-Suweiqa area of Old Aleppo, although some saw the assault on Old Aleppo as a diversionary attack so the Army could take control of the Handarat Camp where fighting continued.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-hospital-idUSKCN11Y0QG|title=Warplanes knock out Aleppo hospitals as Russian-backed assault intensifies|date=29 September 2016|publisher=Reuters}} On 29 September, pro-government forces broke through the last rebel defense line in the Handarat Camp{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-liwaa-al-quds-capture-handarat-camp-northern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army, Liwaa Al-Quds capture most of Handarat Camp in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=29 September 2016|publisher=}} and once again took complete control of the district.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/reuters/article-3813639/Pro-Syrian-government-forces-control-Aleppos-Handarat-camp-rebel.html|title=Pro-Syrian government forces control Aleppo's Handarat camp-rebel|work=Daily Mail}} In order to secure Handarat Camp, government troops continued with their assault and attacked the nearby Shaqayf district,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/latest-battlefield-map-aleppo-city/|title=Latest battlefield map of Aleppo City|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=29 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=30 September 2016}} as well as the Kindi Hospital.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-advances-kindi-hospital-northern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army advances to Kindi Hospital in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=29 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=30 September 2016}} The next morning, after heavy clashes, pro-government forces captured the Kindi Hospital, thus fortifying their positions at the Handarat Camp{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-captures-strategic-kindi-hospital-northern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army captures strategic Kindi Hospital in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=30 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=30 September 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUSKCN1200Q9|title=Syrian army, rebels wage fierce battles in Aleppo|date=30 September 2016|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=30 September 2016}} and coming within two kilometers of the Jandoul roundabout.{{cite web|url=https://www.abqjournal.com/857052/syrian-troops-capture-hospital-north-of-aleppo.html|title=Updated: Syrian troops capture hospital north of Aleppo|agency=Associated Press|accessdate=30 September 2016}} Soon after, the military started an operation against the rebel-held central district of Suleiman Al-Halabi{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-begins-new-military-operation-east-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army begins new military operation in east Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=30 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=30 September 2016}} and advanced, seizing much of its western sector.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-advances-east-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army advances in east Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=30 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=30 September 2016}} However, after advancing, government troops withdrew and the rebels recaptured their lost positions.[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=51568 Violent clashes in Suleiman al-Halabi area and about 15 were killed and injured at the eastern and western neighborhoods of Aleppo] During the fighting in Suleiman Al-Halabi, which was described as "back and forth", a water station was bombed, with both sides trading blame. The Army was trying to reach the rebel-held station since it was the main water source for the government-held part of Aleppo.{{cite web |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3815465/Halt-Aleppo-bloodbath-MSF-tells-Damascus-Moscow.html|title=Syria regime advances in Aleppo, MSF decries 'bloodbath' |work=Daily Mail|accessdate=30 September 2016}} Later in the day, the rebels reentered the Kindi hospital, reigniting fighting for the building,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/fatah-halab-reenters-kindi-hospital-amid-massive-counter-assault-northern-aleppo/|title=Fatah Halab reenters Kindi Hospital amid massive counter-assault in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=30 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=30 September 2016}} while the Army reportedly captured the northwestern part of the Bustan Al-Basha district.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-captures-several-sites-key-northern-aleppo-district/|title=Syrian Army captures several sites in key northern Aleppo district|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=30 September 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=30 September 2016}} The rebels eventually managed to recapture the hospital.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-captures-territory-northern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army captures more territory in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=1 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=3 October 2016}} On 1 October, the Syrian Army continued to advance in the Bustan Al-Basha district,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-verge-capturing-key-aleppo-district/|title=Syrian Army on the verge of capturing key Aleppo district|first=Izat|last=Charkatli|date=1 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=3 October 2016}} although subsequently the rebels claimed to had recaptured the positions they lost in Bustan Al-Basha,{{cite web|url=http://www.cnsnews.com/news/article/russia-warns-against-us-attack-syrian-forces|title=Russia warns against US attack on Syrian forces|date=1 October 2016|publisher=CNS News|accessdate=3 October 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161003054600/http://www.cnsnews.com/news/article/russia-warns-against-us-attack-syrian-forces|archive-date=3 October 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} while elsewhere government forces captured Tal Shuqayf hill and 16 nearby buildings, establishing fire control over the Aleppo Armament Base and the Shuqayf Industrial Area.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-makes-huge-gains-northern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army makes huge gains in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=1 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=3 October 2016}} The next day, the Army seized the Shuqayf Industrial area,[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=51698 The regime forces advance north of Aleppo city and tens of airstrikes target the eastern neighborhoods of the city and casualties in the countryside] the Jandoul beltway{{cite web|url=http://www.qasioun.net/en/news/show/38473/Regime_forces_seize_over_Shaqif_factories_and_Jandoul_beltway_in_north_of_Aleppo|title=Regime forces seize over Shaqif factories and Jandoul beltway in north of Aleppo |agency=Qasion News Agency|accessdate=3 October 2016}} and the Kindi Hospital.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-idUSKCN1220FR|title=Syria presses Aleppo advance, tells rebels to leave|date=2 October 2016|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=3 October 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/field-report-syrian-army-makes-fresh-gains-northern-aleppo-map-update/|title=Field Report: Syrian Army makes fresh gains in northern Aleppo. Map Update|first=Zen|last=Adra|date=2 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=3 October 2016}} During the Army's gains at Shuqayf, the Kurdish [[People's Protection Units|YPG]] militia also advanced against the rebels at the Jandoul [[roundabout]].[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=51723 The regime forces reach al-Jandoul roundabout area and the violent clashes continue in Aleppo city] Meanwhile, Army advances in Bustan Al-Basha continued,{{cite web |url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-continue-massive-aleppo-offensive/|title=Syrian Army continue massive Aleppo offensive|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=2 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=3 October 2016}} with government forces reaching the outskirts of the al-Heluk district,{{cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/10/syrian-army-advances-aleppo-carnage-sparks-fury-161002105654608.html|title=Syrian army advances as 'Aleppo carnage' sparks fury|publisher=Al Jazeera |accessdate=3 October 2016}} while a new Army attack on the Suleiman Al-Halabi water station was again repelled.{{cite web|url=http://www.qasioun.net/en/news/show/38477/Opposition_repels_regime%E2%80%99s_attack_in_Aleppo|title=Opposition repels regime’s attack in Aleppo |agency=Qasion News Agency |accessdate=3 October 2016}} Elsewhere, the largest hospital in the rebel part of the city, known as M10, was once again bombed.{{cite web |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/10/syria-war-aleppo-hospital-bombed-time-161001135413643.html|title=Syria's war: Aleppo hospital bombed again|publisher=Al Jazeera|accessdate=3 October 2016}} At this point, the Army called on the rebels to withdraw from Aleppo, offering them safe passage and aid supplies. ===Syrian Army push on three fronts=== On 3 October, Syrian government forces attacked the Owaija district{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-cotninues-massive-advance-northern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army cotninues massive advance in northern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=3 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=3 October 2016}} and reportedly seized a quarter of the area before sundown, while the Army established fire control over the Jandoul roundabout.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/fierce-clashes-reported-northern-aleppo-syrian-army-attempts-advance/|title=Fierce clashes reported all over northern Aleppo as the Syrian Army attempts to advance|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=3 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=3 October 2016}} The same day, the M10 hospital was bombed for the third time{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/major-hospital-aleppo-syria-bombed-time-days/story?id=42533806|title=Major Aleppo Hospital Bombed for Third Time in Days|date=3 October 2016|publisher=ABC News|accessdate=3 October 2016}} and completely destroyed.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3820016/Air-raids-destroy-largest-hospital-rebel-held-parts-Aleppo-NGO.html|title=Air raids destroy largest hospital in rebel-held parts of Aleppo: NGO|work=Daily Mail|accessdate=3 October 2016}} On 4 October, the rebels claimed that an Army assault on the southern Sheikh Sa'id district had been repelled,{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUSKCN1240WU|title=Rebels fend off Aleppo assault as nations seek to rebuild peace process|date=4 October 2016|publisher=Reuters}} while a government source stated they had reached a bridge in the northwestern part of the district.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-hezbollah-advance-key-southern-aleppo-district/|title=Syrian Army, Hezbollah advance at key southern Aleppo district|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=4 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News}} Meanwhile, the military advanced in the city center, capturing several high-rise buildings,{{cite web|url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/syria-army-advances-in-aleppo-after-us-drops-russia-talks/|title=Syria army advances in Aleppo after US drops Russia talks}} as well as in the factories area of the northern Owaija district.[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=51796 60 killed or wounded by shells targeted Aleppo neighborhoods.] For the first time in four years, Syrian Army tanks crossed the frontline in Aleppo.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/10/syria-government-tanks-roll-rebel-held-aleppo-161004190513206.html|title=Syrian government forces advance on rebel-held Aleppo|publisher=Al Jazeera}} On 5 October, Syrian Army advances continued in the northern district of Owaija and the southern district of Al-Amiriyah.[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/05/شهداء-وجرحى-في-قصف-صاروخي-على-أحياء-بمد/ شهداء وجرحى في قصف صاروخي على أحياء بمدينة حلب وقوات النظام تتقدم في جنوب وشمال هذه الأحياء]{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/field-report-syrian-army-gains-territories-north-aleppo-map-update/|title=Field Report: Syrian Army gains more territories in north Aleppo. Map Update|first=Zen|last=Adra|date=5 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News}} As of 6 October, government forces were in control of 50–80% of the Bustan Al-Basha district{{cite web|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/world/syria-army-seizes-rebel-territory-in-heart-of-aleppo/3185186.html|title=Syria army seizes rebel territory in heart of Aleppo|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=https://test.almasdarnews.com/article/point-no-return-islamist-rebels-lose-ground-aleppo-city-map-update/|title=Point of no return as Islamist rebels lose more ground in Aleppo city - Map update|first=Chris|last=Tomson|date=6 October 2016|publisher=}} 45–50% of Owaija{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/TheInsideSourc/status/783930463496708097|title=The Inside Source on Twitter|publisher=}} and the northern Bakarah Quarries{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/video-syrian-war-update-october-6-8-syrian-army-continues-advance-eastern-aleppo/|title=In Video: Syrian War Update. October 6–8. Syrian Army continues to advance in Eastern Aleppo|first=Zen|last=Adra|date=9 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=16 October 2016}} that overlook the Kindi Hospital. With the new advances in Bustan Al-Basha, the Army was closing in on the Suleiman Al-Halabi water station from two sides[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/06/%D9%82%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%B8%D8%A7%D9%85-%D8%AA%D8%AA%D9%85%D9%83%D9%86-%D9%85%D9%86-%D8%AA%D8%AD%D9%82%D9%8A%D9%82-%D8%A3%D9%88%D9%84-%D8%AA%D9%82%D8%AF%D9%85-%D9%87%D8%A7%D8%AF/ قوات النظام تتمكن من تحقيق أول تقدم هاد لها وسط مدينة حلب منذ أكثر من 3 سنوات] and by dusk they had secured the Suleiman Al-Halabi district.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-captures-strategic-district-east-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army captures strategic district in east Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=6 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=9 October 2016}}[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/06/%D9%82%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D8%B8%D8%A7%D9%85-%D8%AA%D8%AA%D9%85%D9%83%D9%86-%D9%85%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AA%D9%82%D8%AF%D9%85-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D8%B3%D9%84%D9%8A%D9%85%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%A7/ قوات النظام تتمكن من التقدم في سليمان الحلبي وسط مدينة حلب] Later that night, the Army made advances in the Salah al-Din district and the Bureij area,[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=51880 More than 75 casualties and injuries in Jamelaiah neighborhood at Aleppo city, the regime forces advance within the city again] while they had also reportedly taken control of half of the Sheikh Sa'id district.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-hezbollah-advance-southern-aleppo-amid-crumbling-jihadist-defenses/|title=Syrian Army, Hezbollah advance in southern Aleppo amid the crumbling jihadist defenses|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=7 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=9 October 2016}} Early on 7 October, Syrian government forces continued to assault Sheikh Sa'id, seizing Tal Sheikh Sa'eed hill.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-captures-key-hilltop-southern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army captures key hilltop in southern Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=7 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=9 October 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3827007/Syria-army-makes-gains-Aleppo-Security-Council-meets.html|title=France, Britain at UN call for end to Aleppo 'bloodbath'|work=Daily Mail}} Still, the rebels managed to recapture other territory in the district they had lost. The next day, the rebels were able to reclaim large parts of Sheikh Sa'id and several points around the water station in Suleiman Al-Halabi, leaving them in control of 20% of that district.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/jihadist-rebels-strike-back-aleppo-city/|title=Jihadist rebels strike back in Aleppo City|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=8 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=9 October 2016}} Still, despite this, government forces took complete control of the Owaija district and the Jandoul roundabout.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-seizes-key-district-east-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army seizes key district in east Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=8 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=9 October 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3828432/Battle-Aleppo-rages-ahead-East-West-showdown-UN.html|title=Battle for Aleppo rages ahead of East-West showdown at UN|work=Daily Mail}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3829388/Syria-regime-keeps-Aleppo-assault-UN-fails-truce.html|title=Syria regime keeps up Aleppo assault after UN fails on truce |work=Daily Mail|accessdate=9 October 2016}} Subsequently, the Army took control of over 50% of the nearby Manashar Al-Breij district.{{cite web|url=http://www.insidesourcenews.com/single-post/2016/10/09/Syrian-Army-Tightens-Grip-on-East-Aleppo|title=Syrian Army Tightens Grip on East Aleppo|publisher=The Inside Source|access-date=9 October 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161010125648/http://www.insidesourcenews.com/single-post/2016/10/09/Syrian-Army-Tightens-Grip-on-East-Aleppo|archive-date=10 October 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Army advances also continued in Bustan Al-Basha. On 9 October, back-and-forth fighting raged in Sheikh Sa'id and Bustan Al-Basha.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=51983|title=Violent clashes in Sheikh Saeed after regime forces’ advancement in the area and aerial bombardment north of Aleppo|publisher=Syrian Observatory for Human Rights|accessdate=9 October 2016}}[http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/09/%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%81%D8%B5%D8%A7%D8%A6%D9%84-%D8%AA%D8%B9%D8%A7%D9%88%D8%AF-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AA%D9%82%D8%AF%D9%85-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D8%B1%D9%8A%D9%81-%D8%AD%D9%85%D8%A7%D8%A9-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B4%D9%85%D8%A7/ الفصائل تعاود التقدم في ريف حماة الشمالي الشرقي ومعارك مستمرة بعنف في الشيخ سعيد ومناطق أخرى بمدينة حلب]{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-advances-inside-eastern-aleppo-district/|title=Syrian Army advances inside eastern Aleppo district|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=9 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=9 October 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.insidesourcenews.com/single-post/2016/10/10/Rebels-Fight-Back-In-Aleppo-City|title=The Inside Source|publisher=|accessdate=16 October 2016}} By this point, government forces had seized 15–20% of the rebel-held part of Aleppo, with the rebels struggling to maintain a stable frontline due to a lack of sufficient resources, which had also been impacted by the heavy air campaign against their positions and ammo depots, to counter Army advances. ===Syrian Army secures northern outskirts; Fourth line of attack started=== Early on 10 October, Syrian government troops seized Tal Sifan hill, near Owaija,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-captures-more-territory-in-east-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army captures more territory in east Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=10 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=16 October 2016}} and the following day consolidated their control of the Jandoul roundabout.{{cite web|url=http://www.jamestownsun.com/news/nation-and-world/4134590-rebels-monitor-russian-jets-resume-heavy-bombing-eastern-aleppo|title=Rebels, monitor: Russian jets resume heavy bombing of eastern...|publisher=Jamestown Sun|accessdate=16 October 2016}}[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=52084 Regime forces advance over rebels in Aleppo] Two days later, the Army seized four hills in the northeast of Aleppo, including one that overlooks the Hanano Youth Housing Complex.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-seizes-territory-northeast-aleppo-rebel-defenses-collapse/|title=Syrian Army seizes more territory in northeast Aleppo as rebel defenses collapse|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=13 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=16 October 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/786540647557632000|title=The Inside Source on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=16 October 2016}} Advances in the northeast of Aleppo continued into 14 October,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-captures-territory-northeast-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army captures more territory in northeast Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=14 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=16 October 2016}}[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=52358 The regime forces advance north of Aleppo city, and shelling target several areas at the eastern neighborhoods of the city leaving casualties][http://www.syriahr.com/2016/10/14/8-%D8%B4%D9%87%D8%AF%D8%A7%D8%A1-%D8%AD%D8%B5%D9%8A%D9%84%D8%A9-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%82%D8%B5%D9%81-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AC%D9%88%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%8A%D9%88%D9%85-%D8%B9%D9%84%D9%89-%D9%85%D8%AF%D9%8A%D9%86/ 8 شهداء حصيلة القصف الجوي اليوم على مدينة حلب ومعارك عنيفة شمال المدينة] with the Syrian Army making its first push towards the Youth Housing Complex.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-continues-advance-northeast-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army continues advance in northeast Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=14 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=16 October 2016}} The military also made an effort to open a route between the north of Aleppo and the airport in the south,{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3837865/Intense-air-strikes-batter-Syrias-Aleppo-monitor.html|title=Pro-govt gains in Aleppo ahead of key Syria talks |work=Daily Mail|accessdate=16 October 2016}} managing to take control of most of the Al-Aradh Al-Hamra district in the southeast of Aleppo. Meanwhile, the M10 hospital was once again hit with a bunker-buster bomb.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/oct/14/syrian-regime-bombs-hospital-again-assad-vows-clean-aleppo|title=Aleppo hospital bombed again as Assad vows to 'clean' city|first=Kareem|last=Shaheen|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=16 October 2016|work=The Guardian}} On 15 October, Syrian government forces advanced near the Ba'idayn roundabout, in the north of Aleppo, amid heavy fighting,{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/787130634942545920|title=The Inside Source on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=16 October 2016}} breaching a one kilometer frontline and pushing the rebels back by one kilometer.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/battle-aleppo-rages-syrian-army-advances-map-update/|title=Battle for Aleppo rages on as Syrian Army advances: Map Update|first=Izat|last=Charkatli|date=15 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=16 October 2016}} They also advanced on the Nayrab Bridge-al-Miysar district axis from the direction of the airport, fully securing the Al-Aradh Al-Hamra district,{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-liberate-number-areas-east-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army liberate number of areas in east Aleppo|first=Paul|last=Antonopoulos|date=15 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=16 October 2016}} and seized parts of the nearby Karm al-Trab neighborhood.[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=52433 The regime forces advance and control blocks in the eastern neighborhoods of Aleppo] In the evening, government troops penetrated rebel defense lines at the Ba'idayn roundabout, capturing the surrounding factories.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/787416213424975872|title=The Inside Source on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=30 October 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/Syria_Hezb_Iran/status/787403067171934208|title=24 Resistance Axis on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=30 October 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-captures-several-sites-northeast-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army captures several sites in northeast Aleppo|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=16 October 2016|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=21 October 2016}} On 16 October, a new Syrian Army assault on Sheikh Sa'id was repelled by rebel forces,{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/787761160502194176|title=The Inside Source on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=21 October 2016}} while Syrian government forces advanced in the Salah al-Din district, capturing over 10 buildings.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/787763132298952704|title=The Inside Source on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=21 October 2016}} ==Aftermath – Halt to air-strikes; Rebel counter-offensive== {{main article|Aleppo offensive (October–November 2016)}} On 17 October, Russia announced that it would temporarily halt airstrikes on eastern Aleppo for eight hours on 20 October, in order to allow some civilians and rebels to evacuate.{{cite web|url=https://www.ft.com/content/829853e4-948f-11e6-a1dc-bdf38d484582|title=Russia and Syria announce eight-hour Aleppo ceasefire|work=Financial Times|date=17 October 2016}} The strikes had been halted two days earlier than intended, on the morning of 18 October, and the suspension continued into the next day{{cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/10/19/middleeast/syria-aleppo-airstrikes/index.html|title=Syria: Aleppo residents say airstrikes have halted|author=Schams Elwazer, Eyad Kourdi and Laura Smith-Spark|publisher=CNN|accessdate=21 October 2016}} when it was announced the truce scheduled to take place on 20 October, would be extended to three days until 22 October.{{cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/news/world/syrian-army-says-aleppo-truce-will-last-three-days_1941706.html|title=Syrian Army says Aleppo truce will last three days|date=20 October 2016|publisher=|accessdate=21 October 2016}} Rebel officials completely rejected the proposal on evacuating,{{cite web |url=http://www.middleeasteye.net/news/russia-urges-other-powers-back-its-ceasefire-aleppo-rebels-reject-withdrawal-905667298|title=Rebels reject withdrawal from Aleppo after Russia halts bombing|work=Middle East Eye|date=18 October 2016}} although 100–150 [[Ahrar al-Sham]] rebels from eastern Aleppo were evacuated in three [[bus]]es destined to the [[Idlib Governorate]].{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/southfront-syrian-army-evacuates-150-islamist-rebels-aleppo-city/|title=SouthFront: Syrian Army evacuates 150 Islamist rebels from Aleppo city|work=Al Masdar News|date=19 October 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/788684798902480896|title=The Inside Source on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=21 October 2016}} Additionally, tensions arose between different rebel factions when those that wanted to evacuate were prevented by others,{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/788982667215724548|title=The Inside Source on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=21 October 2016}} and several [[assassination]]s of those who supported withdrawal took place.{{cite tweet |user=InsideSourceInt|number=789720437387165696|date= 21 October 2016|title= A series of assassinations are now taking place across East Aleppo on those who support/encourage withdrawal}} The al-Nusra Front reportedly carried out public executions of residents who attempted to leave the city.{{citation needed|date=November 2016}} Fighting reportedly resumed on 22 October,{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/10/air-strikes-fighting-mark-aleppo-ceasefire-161022203809648.html|title=Air strikes, fighting mark end of Aleppo ceasefire|publisher=Al Jazeera|accessdate=30 October 2016}} with the Army making advances in Salah al-Din early on 24 October.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/InsideSourceInt/status/790354471666618368|title=The Inside Source on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=30 October 2016}} However, Russia declared the ceasefire would continue.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-russia-pause-idUSKCN12P26X|title=Russia says it extends moratorium on Aleppo air strikes|date=25 October 2016|accessdate=30 October 2016|agency=Reuters}} On 28 October, rebel forces outside Aleppo began [[Aleppo offensive (October 2016)|a counter-offensive]] to break the siege.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-37798924|title=Syrian rebels 'start Aleppo offensive'|publisher=BBC News|date=28 October 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-offensive-idUSKCN12S0QP|title=Syria monitor group says rebel shelling kills more than 15 in west Aleppo|agency=Reuters|date=28 October 2016}} ==Reactions and analysis== Syria's president Bashar al-Assad said that the conflict had become a war by proxy between the Russian and US superpowers, who were still embroiled in a [[cold war|Cold War]]. According to him, the offensive was a necessary step towards pushing terrorists out of Syria and into Turkey.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-idUSKCN12D2FY|title=Syria's Assad says taking Aleppo from rebels key to pushing 'terrorists' back to Turkey|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=16 October 2016|agency=Reuters}} ''[[Reuters]]'' and ''[[The Los Angeles Times]]'' described the offensive as a possible turning point in the war.{{cite web|url=http://in.reuters.com/article/mideast-crisis-syria-idINKCN11Y1QM|title=Warplanes knock out Aleppo hospitals as Russian-backed assault intensifies|date=28 September 2016|author=Ellen Francis, Tom Perry|publisher=Reuters|access-date=}}[http://www.latimes.com/world/middleeast/la-fg-syria-aleppo-20160928-snap-story.html Why the fight for Aleppo is a turning point in the Syrian war]. ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'', 28 September 2016. Retrieved 30 September 2016. At the [[United Nations]], the [[United States Ambassador to the United Nations|U.S. Ambassador to the UN]], [[Samantha Power]], accused Russia of "barbarism" because of its air-strikes during the offensive,{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-37468080|title=Syria conflict: US accuses Russia of 'barbarism' in Aleppo|date=25 September 2016 |publisher=BBC News|accessdate=3 October 2016}} while the United Kingdom and France accused Russia was involved in war crimes.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/sep/25/russia-accused-war-crimes-syria-un-security-council-aleppo|title=Russia accused of war crimes in Syria at UN security council session|author=Julian Borger Kareem Shaheen |date=26 September 2016|accessdate=3 October 2016|work=The Guardian}} According to the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' and unnamed "longtime observers" of the Syrian conflict, the Syrian and Russian bombardments in the week of 22–28 September were "marked by unparalleled savagery and suffering". ==See also== {{Portal|Syrian Civil War|2010s}} * [[Northern Aleppo offensive (February 2016)]] * [[2016 Southern Aleppo campaign]] * [[2016 Aleppo campaign]] ** [[Aleppo offensive (June–July 2016)]] ** [[Aleppo offensive (July–August 2016)]] ** [[Aleppo offensive (August–September 2016)]] ** [[Aleppo offensive (October–November 2016)]] ** [[Aleppo offensive (November–December 2016)]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{Syrian Civil War}} {{Infobox Election | election_name = Algerian legislative election, 1987 | country = Algeria | type = parliamentary | ongoing = no | previous_election = Algerian legislative election, 1982 | previous_year = 1982 | next_election = Algerian legislative election, 1991 | next_year = 1991 | seats_for_election = All 295 seats to the [[People's National Assembly]]
148 seats were needed for a majority | election_date = 26 February 1987 | colour1 = ff7070 | image1 = [[File:Chadli.jpg|150px]] | leader1 = '''[[Chadli Bendjedid]]''' | alliance1 = | party1 = National_Liberation_Front_(Algeria) | leaders_seat1 = | last_election1 = '''282''' | seats1 = '''295''' | seat_change1 = '''{{increase}}13''' | popular_vote1 = '''9,910,631''' | percentage1 ='''100%''' | swing1 = - | title = Prime Minister | before_election = [[Abdelhamid Brahimi]] | after_election = [[Abdelhamid Brahimi]] | before_party = National Rally for Democracy (Algeria) | after_party = National Rally for Democracy (Algeria) }} {{Politics of Algeria}} '''Parliamentary elections''' were held in [[Algeria]] on 26 February 1987. The country was a [[one-party state]] at the time, with the [[National Liberation Front (Algeria)|National Liberation Front]] (FLN) as the sole legal party. The FLN nominated 885 candidates for the 295 seats, with voters asked to express their preference by crossing out names on the ballot. Only 67 of the 132 incumbents who ran for re-election were successful. Voter turnout was over 87%.[http://www.ipu.org/parline-e/reports/arc/ALGERIA_1987_E.PDF Algeria] Inter-Parliamentary Union ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats |- |align=left|[[National Liberation Front (Algeria)|National Liberation Front]]|| ||100||295 |- |align=left|'''Total'''||'''9,910,631'''||'''100'''||'''295''' |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||11,328,680||87.48||– |- |align=left colspan=4|Source: [http://www.ipu.org/parline-e/reports/arc/ALGERIA_1987_E.PDF IPU] |} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Algerian elections}} [[Category:Elections in Algeria]] [[Category:1987 elections in Africa]] [[Category:1987 in Algeria]] [[Category:One-party elections]]

'''Anna Eleonora Ekelöf''' ([[floruit|fl.]] 1765), was a [[Swedes|Swedish]] serial [[impostor]]. She committed fraud with a series of [[false identity|false identities]], posing as [[mamsell]], [[noblewoman]], [[officer]], Count and the [[Gustav III of Sweden|Crown Prince of Sweden]] before her arrest in 1765.
==First fraud== In June 1765, Anna Ekelöf was arrested dressed in male clothing in [[Värmland]] near the Swedish-Norwegian border. Being put on trial for investigation, she was revealed to have committed a serial of [[identity fraud]]s. Witnesses testified that she was first encountered in the border area dressed as a [[mamsell]], claiming to be on the run to marry her beloved, who was not approved by her parents. After this, she dressed herself as a nobleman with a white wig and introduced herself as Count Carl Ekeblad, who had merely been forced to escape Sweden dressed as a woman after having been exiled from Stockholm due to an incident, and who was merely awaiting the King's forgiveness to return.
As Count Ekeblad, she had recruited a retinue of Swedes and Norwegians, among them the runaway Swedish farmer Olof Persson, the runaway Swedish baker Schutlz, who acted as servants, as well as the wife of Police officer Istmin, Emerentia Schröder, "To dance and ammuse himself with". She was housed at the Löfsnäs manor in Norway, belong to the sister of Emerentia. During her time as Count, Ekelöf lived a "debauched life with drinking, foul language, foolhardily riding and a never ending use of tobacco", and was also known to threaten and struck people who opposed her. She defended herself by saying that she had only acted in such a way to be trustworthy in her role as a man.
==Second fraud== At the customary office of [[Magnebro]], she then had rumors spread which let it be known that she was in fact the Swedish Crown Prince in disguise who, in a conflict with [[riksråd]] Count [[Carl Gustaf Tessin]] and the nobility party of the parliament, had come to prepare a [[coup d'etat]] to depose the government. This was in fact not an unlikely rumor, as there was at the time many serious rumors circulating about planned uprisings against the government since the [[Coup of 1756]] by [[Louisa Ulrika of Prussia|Queen Louisa Ulrika]]. The actual Crown Prince was in the same age and with the same fragile built as Ekelöf, and Anna Ekelöf was furthermore equipped with a vast and up to date knowledge about the current political situation.
When rumors reached the Danish-Norwegian authorities in [[Oslo]] that someone alleged to be the Swedish heir to the throne was present at the border, Ekelöf was taken captive and brought to Oslo, where her identity as a woman was discovered. She was apparently allowed to return to the border, but was soon after arrested by the Swedish authorities, who subjected her to a physical examination to establish her gender.
==Trial== Anna Ekelöf admitted posing as a Count, but denied to have ever posed as the heir to the throne, and if so, only under the intoxication of alcohol. She stated that she was the 20-year-old daughter of a diseased sea captain in Gothenburg, and that she had run away from home to elope and meet her beloved, sergeant Magnus Sandberg, in Norway, where they could marry without the approval of his disapproving parents. She had not intended to pose as a man, she had merely put the clothes on, after having been provided them by a runaway Swedish baker on the way, because her own clothes had been damaged during the trip and the nobleman clothes was nearer to her social class as a mamsell. The whole posing as a count was merely an innocent play while she awaited to be united with her beloved.
The authorities, furthermore, suspected her to have eloped over the border with the purpose of performing an abortion, and suggested that her relationship with Magnus Sandberg was in fact incestuous. During the trial, it was discovered that she on several previous occasions had left a trace of false identities: she had, on various occasions, posed as a runaway girl, fleeing from an arranged marriage to marry her true love. The story of a girl eloping for love dressed as a man was a popular motive in contemporary novels, a story she apparently used often in past deceptions.
The only testimony that may give a suggestion to her real identity, was a testimony given a previous trial, in which she had been imprisoned at [[Halmstad Castle]]. At that occasion, care taker Emanuel Bergman from [[Borås]] pointed her out to be the same person as a certain ”Passannicka” ('Pass Port-Annicka'), who had previously been subjected to physical punishment for crimes committed in Borås and exiled from that city.<ref>Jonas Liliequist: "'Att inte kunna förställa sig är att inte kunna leva' - om personlighet, identitet och kön i 1600- och 1700-talens Sverige" i Tom Eriksson & Agneta, Guillemot (red) Individ och struktur i historisk belysning. Festskrift till Sune Åkerman (Umeå 1997).</ref>
==Aftermath== The true identity of Anna Ekelöf was never established, as she managed to escape custody and was never caught again. On her way to court to hear her verdict, the prison carriage broke down, and the party was forced to spend the night on the farm of the peasant Nils Amundsson. She managed to convince him that she was indeed the crown prince in disguise, and that he would be richly rewarded if he assisted her escape. The night of 12–13 June 1765, Amundsson knocked on her window, and she climbed out and mounted a horse he provided her, rode of toward the Norwegian border and was never seen again. Amundsson claimed that he had been so "intoxicated" by her talk that he had become "prepared to sacrifice his life and property" for her.<ref>Jonas Liliequist: "'Att inte kunna förställa sig är att inte kunna leva' - om personlighet, identitet och kön i 1600- och 1700-talens Sverige" i Tom Eriksson & Agneta, Guillemot (red) Individ och struktur i historisk belysning. Festskrift till Sune Åkerman (Umeå 1997).</ref>
Anna Ekelöf was not the only female criminal posing as a man in early modern Sweden. Kerstin Pedersdotter ran away from her abusive husband dressed as a man under the name Christopher and took refuge with her stepbrother, with whom she made a theft tour through the countryside, and was, similar to Ekelöf, accused of having dressed as a man to hide an incestuous relationship. Gunilla Harberg, known as ”Tjuv-Gunnil” (Gunnil the Thief), had escaped to [[Karlskrona]] dressed as a man under the name Gunnar after a burglary in [[Kalmar]].

{{Infobox military conflict |conflict=Battle of Spilia |partof=[[Cyprus Emergency]] |image= |place= [[Cyprus]] |date= 12 December 1955 |result=Greek Cypriot victory |combatant1={{flagicon image|Flag of Greece (1822-1978).svg}} [[EOKA]] |combatant2={{flagicon|United Kingdom}} [[British Empire|British troops]] |commander1={{flagicon image|Flag of Greece (1822-1978).svg}} [[Georgios Grivas]]
{{flagicon image|Flag of Greece (1822-1978).svg}} [[Grigoris Afxentiou]] |commander2= unknown |strength1= 12 guerrilla warriors{{cite web|title=Η θρυλική μάχη στα Σπήλια. Ο ηρωικός Γρηγόρης Αυξεντίου στήνει παγίδα θανάτου στους Βρετανούς, που μπερδεύονται και αλληλοεξοντώνονται!|url=http://www.mixanitouxronou.gr/thriliki-machi-sta-spilia-o-iroikos-grigoris-afxentiou-stini-pagida-thanatou-stous-vretanous-pou-berdevonte-ke-alliloexontononte/|website=Μήχανη του Χρώνου}} |strength2={{flagicon|United Kingdom}} 700 |casualties1=None |casualties2={{flagicon|United Kingdom}} 50 total:
4 dead
46 wounded
An unknown number missing
(all from [[friendly fire]]) | }} {{Campaignbox Cyprus Emergency}} The '''Battle of Spilia''' was fought on 12 December 1955 in the [[EOKA]] campaign against the [[United Kingdom|British]] in [[Cyprus]].The Memoirs of General Grivas, edited by Charles Foley, p. 54 Acting on information provided by an informant,The Memoirs of General Grivas, edited by Charles Foley, p. 57 700 soldiers of the British Army attempted to encircle the headquarters of EOKA General [[Georgios Grivas]] on the [[Troodos mountains]] near the village of [[Spilia, Cyprus|Spilia]].The Memoirs of General Grivas, edited by Charles Foley, p. 56 As they ascended the mountain, EOKA guerrillas spotted them. Grivas divided his troops in two, keeping half with himself to fight the units coming from the north side while sending his second-in-command [[Grigoris Afxentiou]] to fight the rest of the British who were ascending on the south side. Both EOKA units retreated to the summit of the mountain after engaging the enemy and then proceeded, in heavy fog, to escape towards the west. Soon, the British units from the north and the ones from the south reached the summit and, unable to see clearly in the fog, and in the belief that they were surrounded by EOKA fighters, started shooting and calling in airstrikes at each other for eight hours with 50 casualties — 4 deaths and 46 injuries. This was a renowned battle in the EOKA campaign to unite Cyprus with [[Greece]] (1955–1959). It was significant in that a British victory at Spilia would have ended the campaign in its very first year since General Grivas had concentrated his [[guerrilla warfare|guerrilla fighters]], nearly thirty of them, there.The Memoirs of General Grivas, edited by Charles Foley, p. 55 Instead, the struggle went on and led, if not to union (''[[Enosis]]''), to the independence of Cyprus. ==References== {{reflist}} * [http://www.johnpap.net/not-en/proKypros/GrhgorhsAyjentioy.htm] Grigoris Afxentiou, a Cypriot fighter * [http://www.orc.gov.cy/orc/orc.nsf/LookupIDs/89F46283728C2F2CC2256AD30032D757?OpenDocument&languageNo=2] Learn About Cyprus article (Greek language article about Grigoris Afxentiou) [[Category:Conflicts in 1955|Spilia]] [[Category:1955 in Cyprus]] [[Category:Battles involving Cyprus|Spilia]] [[Category:Friendly fire incidents]] [[Category:EOKA]] [[Category:Cyprus Emergency]] [[Category:December 1955 events]] {{Cyprus-stub}}

{{Other uses|The Battle of the Champions (disambiguation){{!}}The Battle of the Champions}} {{Infobox Military Conflict |conflict = Battle of the Champions |partof = |image = |caption = |date = [[540s BC|546 BC]] |place = [[Thyrea, Greece]] |result = Indecisive |combatant1 = [[Sparta]] |combatant2 = [[Argos]] |commander1 = |commander2 = |strength1 = 300 hoplites |strength2 = 300 hoplites |casualties1 = 299 men |casualties2 = 298 men }}
The '''Battle of the 300 Champions''', known since Herodotus' day as the '''Battle of the Champions''', was a battle fought in roughly 546 BC between [[Argos]] and [[Sparta]]. Rather than commit full armies both sides agreed to pitting 300 of their best men against each other.
According to [[Herodotus]]<ref>[http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Hdt.+1.82&fromdoc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.01.0126 Herodotus, The Histories 1.82]</ref> Sparta had surrounded and captured the plain of Thyrea. When the Argives marched out to defend it, the two armies agreed to let 300 champions from each city fight, with the winner taking the territory. Presumably the idea was to reduce the total number of casualties. Both armies marched home, so as to prevent either side from helping their champions and escalating the duel into a full battle.
Neither side would allow for any injured men to be taken. The day called for complete destruction of the enemy force for victory. The two armies were evenly matched and neither could gain the upper hand. They fought until nightfall, and after a bloody battle only three men remained, two Argives and one Spartan. The Argives, Alcenor and Chromius, believing that they had killed all of the Spartans, left the battlefield racing home to Argos to announce their victory. However, they had made one mistake: Othryades, an injured Spartan had survived. As he was technically the last man standing on the battlefield from either army, he too claimed victory. He survived long enough to tell his baggage handlers of this, and then he committed suicide. By tradition, Othryades was ashamed to be the only man in his unit to live, and so he killed himself on the field of battle rather than return to Sparta. The reason for the suicide is up for debate, but the act is of great importance. Othryades did not die by an Argive sword, and the Spartans could always claim that he survived the battle and killed himself in shame, thus gaining an upper hand due to this act of honor.
Both sides were able to claim victory: the Argives because more of their champions had survived, and the Spartans because their single champion held the field. Argos did not take too kindly to the Spartans claiming victory and sent their entire [[hoplite]] army which was met by a Spartan force of equal magnitude. The Spartans won a decisive victory and as a result gained control of [[Thyrea, Greece|Thyreatis]].
[[Pausanias (geographer)|Pausanias]] adds that the battle was foretold by the [[Sibyl]], and that the Argives considered themselves the victors and dedicated a bronze sculpture of the Trojan horse at Delphi to commemorate the victory. However, Pausanias says that the sculptor of this horse was [[Antiphanes of Argos]], who dates to ca. 400 BC. Therefore, either Pausanias is mistaken, or he is confusing this with a battle at Thyrea in 424 BC.
Years later, in 420 BC during a lull in the [[Peloponnesian War]], Argos challenged Sparta to a rematch of the Battle of the 300 Champions. Sparta declined.
