revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2012}} {{Infobox music festival | music_festival_name = Warped Tour | image = Vans Warped Tour Logo.png | caption = | location = United States, Canada | years_active = 1995–2018<!--- Do NOT change this until it officially comes to an end in 2018---> | founders = [[Kevin Lyman]] | dates = June–August | genre = <!-- genres should be kept few and general; please don't add subgenres such as post-hardcore --> | website = {{URL|vanswarpedtour.com}} }}
The '''Warped Tour''' was a traveling [[Rock music|rock]] [[Concert tour|tour]] that had toured the [[United States]] (including 3 or 4 stops in [[Canada]]) annually each summer from 1995 to 2018. It was the largest traveling music festival in the [[United States]],<ref>{{cite web|last1=Owens|first1=Paige|title=Vans Warped Tour Pittsburgh Welcomes Local Band to the Stage|url=http://maniacmagazine.com/culture/music/vans-warped-tour-pittsburgh-welcomes-local-band-to-the-stage/|website=ManiacMagazine.com|publisher=Maniac Magazine|accessdate=19 August 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150819002041/http://maniacmagazine.com/culture/music/vans-warped-tour-pittsburgh-welcomes-local-band-to-the-stage/|archivedate=August 19, 2015 |date=17 July 2015}}</ref> and was the longest-running touring music festival in North America.<ref>Hiatt, Brian. "Rock & Roll: Punk-Rock Circus-How the No Frills Warped Tour Grew into America's Most Successful Festival." Rolling Stone 14 July 2005: 28. Print.</ref> The first Warped Tour took place in 1995, and the [[skateboard]] shoe manufacturer [[Vans]] became the main sponsor of the tour starting with the second tour in 1996, when it became known as the '''Vans Warped Tour'''.<ref name=waddell>{{cite magazine |last=Waddell |first=Roy |date=2015-07-31 |title=Vans Warped Tour Founder Kevin Lyman Reflects on 20th Anniversary: 'I Love It When People Talk Sh-t About Me' |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/business/6649267/kevin-lyman-warped-tour-20th-anniversary-interview |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |publisher=Lynne Segall |access-date=2016-01-28 }}</ref> Although Vans continued to be the main sponsor and lended its name to the festival, other sponsors also participated with stages or other aspects of the festival sometimes being named after them.
Warped Tour was conceived in 1995 as an eclectic [[alternative rock]] festival, but in 1996 began focusing on [[punk rock]] music.<ref name=waddell /> Although it has continued to be known primarily as a punk rock festival, it has included acts of diverse genres over the years.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://thenewfury.com/wordpress/wait-played-warped-10-surprising-warped-tour-alumni/ |title=Wait, They Played Warped? 10 Surprising Warped Tour Alumni |author=newfurymedia |date=2015-02-17 |website=thenewfury.com |publisher=The New Fury |access-date=2016-01-29}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine |last=Crane |first=Matt |date=2015-01-23 |title=10 Reasons You Should Be Especially Excited For Warped Tour This Year |url=http://www.altpress.com/features/entry/10_reasons_you_should_be_especially_excited_for_warped_tour_this_year |magazine=[[Alternative Press (music magazine)|Alternative Press]] |location=[[Cleveland, Ohio]] |publisher=Alternative Press Magazine, Inc. |access-date=2016-01-29 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=O'Connor |first=Christopher |date=1999-03-11 |title=Vans Warped Tour Goes Hip-Hop |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/512761/vans-warped-tour-goes-hip-hop/ |publisher=MTV |website=MTV.com |access-date=2016-01-29 }}</ref>
Warped Tour founder [[Kevin Lyman]] stated that the 2018 Vans Warped Tour would be the final, full cross-country run. Lyman did hint at a large celebration in 2019; the 25th year of the tour.<ref>{{cite news |first=Medea |last=Giordano |date=July 3, 2018 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/07/03/style/warped-tour-vans.html |title=R.I.P. Warped Tour. At Least We Still Have Vans. |work=The New York Times |access-date=July 3, 2018}}</ref>
== Overview == [[File:Warped Tour schedule 2010-08-10.jpg|thumb|right|The performance schedule for the August 10, 2010 stop in [[Chula Vista, California]], giving stages and set times for each act. Set times are determined on the day of the show and are posted for attendees on a large inflatable board.]]
The band times and sets were found on an inflatable lineup, or can be purchased from a stand.
Every year there was a "BBQ Band". In exchange for the privilege of playing on the tour, the BBQ Band prepared the post-show barbecue held for the bands and crew most evenings. Past BBQ Bands have included [[Dropkick Murphys]], Art of Shock and "The Fabulous Rudies".<ref>[http://www.charleston.net/stories/?newsID=94008&section=preview] {{dead link|date=September 2016}}</ref> Similarly, one band, Animo (formerly DORK), has been permitted for the past four years to play on the tour in exchange for working on the setup crew. The "BBQ Band" for the 2016 tour was the band Reckless Serenade.
The tour started as a [[skate punk]] and [[third wave ska|third-wave ska]] tour, but later began to feature mostly [[pop punk]] and [[metalcore]] acts. There are also some [[hardcore punk|hardcore]] and [[street punk]] bands, such as [[the Casualties]], [[the Unseen (band)|the Unseen]] and [[Anti-Flag]], that still play Warped Tour, as well as older bands that have played the tour numerous times since its inception ([[Bad Religion]], [[NOFX]], etc.)
The tour wasn't set up in just one way; every show at every venue had a different layout. It was set up early in the morning during the set up crews' arrival and taken down usually during the last show of the day. When heading into Canada, there was a bus that loaded the supplies that headed into Canada while the other bus contains the equipment that stayed in the U.S. until the next show.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3407256/?ref_=tt_ep_ep4|title=Oh. Canada.|date=January 1, 2014|publisher=|accessdate=September 24, 2016|via=IMDb}}</ref>
In 2013, Kevin Lyman decided to allow parents free admission to the Warped Tour. Citing issues such as transportation problems for minors and the audience member demographic opening up to a younger crowd every year, Lyman determined that parents accompanying their children would be allowed into the tour for free. Parents have their own adult day care.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.punknews.org/article/52019/warped-tour-offering-free-admission-for-parents |title=Warped Tour offering free admission for parents |publisher=Punknews.org |date=2013-06-20 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> It was known as Reverse Day Care.<ref>{{cite web|last=Minichino |first=Nick |url=http://blogs.villagevoice.com/music/2012/07/warped_tour_reverse_daycare_parents.php |title=Scenes From Warped Tour's "Reverse Daycare": Blazing Saddles, Air Conditioning, And Parents' Memories Of Concerts Past | Village Voice |publisher=Blogs.villagevoice.com |date=2012-07-24 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> Grown-ups could spend the day waiting for their children in the Reverse Day Care tent. There was ample seating and often fans or cooling devices to keep the parents occupied during the festival.
==Bands== {{main article|List of Warped Tour lineups by year}}
==History== [[File:Warped Tour stages 2010-08-10 02.jpg|right|thumb|The ''[[Alternative Press (music magazine)|Alternative Press]]''/Advent stage (left) and [[Glamour Kills]] stage (right) on the 2010 tour, an example of the tour's side-by-side stage setup. Acts play alternating 30-minute set times on the two stages.]] The Warped Tour was created in 1995 by [[Kevin Lyman]], in production with the short lived Warp Magazine and [[Creative Artists Agency]]. The tour began June 21 at the Idaho Center in Boise, Idaho, and ended August 18 in Detroit. <ref>{{cite web|last1=Waddell|first1=Ray|title=Venue Views: Warped Wrap|url=http://search.proquest.com.ezproxy2.library.arizona.edu/docview/988641?accountid=8360|website=International Index to Music Periodicals Full Text|publisher=Prometheus Global Media|accessdate=29 September 2014}}</ref>
The tour was usually held at outdoor venues, though on rare occasions it was held indoors. In 1996, due to problems with the venue where the event was to be held, the show was forced to be moved indoors to [[The Capitol Ballroom]] nightclub in Washington DC.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.freewebs.com/44blinkingangels/tourarchives.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-06-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090704084141/http://www.freewebs.com/44blinkingangels/tourarchives.htm |archivedate=July 4, 2009 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
1996 was the first year for Vans as a sponsor and they have been the main sponsor ever since carrying their name in the title.
In 1998, the tour went international, including venues in Australia, Japan, Europe, Canada, and the United States.
In 1999, the tour started off in New Zealand, Australia and Hawaii in the New Year. It then started up again in the United States for the northern hemisphere summer before ending up in Europe.
The Vans Warped Tour has turned eco-friendly by using biodiesel for the production buses.<ref>Knopper, Steve. "Rock & Roll: Fuel Crisis Hits Tours." Rolling Stone 27 July 2006: 15-16. Print.</ref>
In 2009, the two main stages were condensed into one and bands were given 40-minute sets, as opposed to the traditional 30 minutes across the previous two stages. Despite this, the tour decided to bring back the two main stages concept with 35-minute sets instead for the 2012 tour and beyond.
In 2012, the Warped Tour traveled to London, the first time the tour has left North America since 1999.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mediablasphemy.com/2012/other/vans-warped-tour-coming-to-the-uk/ |title=Vans Warped Tour Coming to the UK |publisher=Media Blasphemy |date=March 30, 2012 |accessdate=2012-07-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151016235421/http://mediablasphemy.com/2012/other/vans-warped-tour-coming-to-the-uk/ |archivedate=October 16, 2015 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> In the UK and Europe, Warped Tour is operated by English promoter [[Kilimanjaro Live]].<ref>[https://www.licklibrary.com/news/2012/3/3432-vans_warped_tour_to_return_to_the_uk_for_the_first_time_since_1999 "Vans Warped Tour to return to the UK for the first time since 1999"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161009071516/https://www.licklibrary.com/news/2012/3/3432-vans_warped_tour_to_return_to_the_uk_for_the_first_time_since_1999 |date=October 9, 2016 }}, ''LickLibrary'', Fri, 30 March 2012</ref> The Warped Tour returned to London in 2015.
===Warped Tour 2009=== On February 10, 2009 details for the annual "Warped Tour Kick Off Party" were announced. The show took place on April 2, 2009 at The Key Club in [[West Hollywood, California|West Hollywood]], [[California]] and featured Warped Tour 2009 bands [[T.S.O.L.]], [[The Adolescents]], [[Sing it Loud]], [[TAT (music band)|TAT]], and TV/TV on the bill.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.warpedtour.com/warpedtour/news.asp?xid=16522&id=1500687 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-06-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090705122709/http://www.warpedtour.com/warpedtour/news.asp?xid=16522&id=1500687 |archivedate=July 5, 2009 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The tour won the Best Festival/Tour Award at the [[Rock on Request Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|accessdate=2010-08-31|url=http://www.rockonrequest.com/id323.html|title=2009 Top In Rock Awards|work=[[Rock on Request]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111009180817/http://www.rockonrequest.com/id323.html|archivedate=October 9, 2011|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
===Warped Tour 2012=== The Warped Tour 2012 kick off party took place March 29, 2012 at [[Club Nokia]] in [[Los Angeles, California]] featuring performances by [[Falling in Reverse]], [[The Used]], [[Yellowcard]], [[Dead Sara]], Matt Toka and Forever Came Calling.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://vanswarpedtour.com/blog/id/1844504 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-06-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120218145156/http://vanswarpedtour.com/blog/id/1844504 |archivedate=February 18, 2012 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> During the [[Toronto]] date, a fan fell unconscious during [[Chelsea Grin]] and died. The band as well as Warped Tour offered their condolences on Twitter.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://loudwire.com/warped-tour-reps-issue-statement-on-death-of-teenage-audience-member/ |title=Warped Tour Reps Issue Statement on Death of Teenage Audience Member |publisher=Loudwire.com |date= |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> For the first time in 14 years, Warped Tour was held in the UK in November 2012. This was also the first year the show Warped Roadies premiered. The show was a behind-the-scenes look at the inner workings of the Vans Warped Tour as it travels across the country with more than 60 bands.
===Warped Tour 2013=== The Warped Tour 2013 kick off party took place March 28, 2013 at [[Club Nokia]] in [[Los Angeles, California]] featuring performances by [[Chiodos]], New Beat Fund, [[Gin Wigmore]], [[MC Lars]], [[Craig Owens (entertainer)|Craig Owens]], [[Dia Frampton]], [[Charlotte Sometimes (musician)|Charlotte Sometimes]], Big Chocolate] [[Echosmith]] and special guests.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.axs.com/events/3621/vans-warped-tour-2013-kick-off-party|title=Vans Warped Tour 2014 Kick-Off Party|work=axs.com|accessdate=September 24, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://kroq.cbslocal.com/2013/02/11/vans-warped-tour-2013-kick-off-party-announced-tickets-now-available/|title=Vans Warped Tour 2013 Kick-Off Party Announced, Tickets Now Available|work=cbslocal.com|accessdate=September 24, 2016}}</ref> The tour will once again return to Europe for the second year in a row with more tour dates.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://propertyofzack.com/post/45270535985/warped-tour-confirms-uk-dates-for-2013-festival/|title=Warped Tour Confirms UK Dates For 2013 Festival|work=propertyofzack.com|accessdate=September 24, 2016}}</ref> For the first time since 2001, Warped Tour will also appear in Australia.
===Warped Tour 2014=== The Warped Tour 2014 kick off party took place on April 1, 2014 at [[Club Nokia]] in [[Los Angeles, California]] featuring performances by [[Bad Rabbits]], [[Issues (band)|Issues]], [[One Ok Rock (band)|One Ok Rock]], [[Secrets (post-hardcore band)|Secrets]], This Wild Life, [[To the Wind]], [[Watsky]], Chelsea Grin, Beartooth, Volumes and more.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://vanswarpedtour.com/dates/los-angeles-ca |title=Los Angeles, CA |publisher=Vans Warped Tour |date=2014-04-01 |accessdate=2014-05-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140404181310/http://vanswarpedtour.com/dates/los-angeles-ca |archivedate=April 4, 2014 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The tour returned to [[Montreal]] for the first time in two years. On February 7, 2014, it was announced that the Warped Tour would visit [[Alaska]] for the first time for a pre-tour "The Road to Warped" show.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://altpress.com/news/entry/all_time_low_falling_in_reverse_more_to_play_the_road_to_warped_tour_alaska|title=All Time Low, Falling In Reverse, more to play The Road To Warped Tour Alaska - News - Alternative Press|work=altpress.com|accessdate=September 24, 2016}}</ref> The entire first date (June 13 at [[Houston]]) was streamed live on the tour's website. In June 2014, Kevin Lyman announced on [[Twitter]] that the UK segment of the 2014 tour would not go ahead.<ref>{{cite tweet |author= Kevin Lyman |user= KevinLyman|number= 479772232260915200 |date= June 19, 2014 |title= No 2014 Warped Tour UK |access-date= June 20, 2014 }}</ref> The San Diego stop was sponsored by Waveborn Sunglasses. As a part of celebrating the 20th anniversary of the tour, there have been surprise appearances from two bands, [[Linkin Park]] played at [[Ventura, California]] on June 22, 2014, and [[A Day to Remember]] played at [[Chicago, Illinois]] on July 19, 2014.
===Warped Tour 2015=== The Warped Tour 2015 kickoff party took place on April 7, 2015 at [[Club Nokia]] in [[Los Angeles, California]] featuring performances by [[As It Is (band)|As It Is]], [[Bebe Rexha]], [[New Years Day (band)|New Years Day]], [[Knuckle Puck]], [[Metro Station (band)|Metro Station]], [[Candy Hearts]], and New Beat Fund. The tour once again visited [[Alaska]] for "The Road to Warped" show. The entire first date (June 19 at [[Pomona, California|Pomona]]) was once again streamed live on the tour's website. The tour returned to Europe playing at the Alexandria Palace in [[London, UK]] on 18 October.
===Warped Tour 2016=== The Warped Tour 2016 announced the lineup on March 22 at the kickoff party at Full Sail University in Florida, featuring select performances by 2016 Warped bands. Headliners of this tour included Falling In Reverse, Less Than Jake, Good Charlotte, Sleeping With Sirens, New Found Glory, and others. The tour kicked off on June 24, 2016, in Dallas, TX and hit 41 cities throughout the summer, ending in Portland, OR on August 13, 2016. In addition to the 41 cities, there was a "Road to Warped Tour Alaska" on June 22, 2016.
===Warped Tour 2017=== The [[Warped Tour 2017]] announced the lineup on March 22 at the kickoff party at [[Full Sail University]] in Florida. Headliners (Bands playing the Journeys Sponsored Stages) of this tour include [[Andy Biersack|Andy Black]], [[Beartooth (band)|Beartooth]], [[Dance Gavin Dance]], [[I Prevail]], and [[New Years Day (band)|New Years Day]], among others. The tour kicked off on June 11, 2017, in [[Seattle, WA]] and will hit 41 cities throughout the summer, ending in [[Pomona, CA]] on August 6, 2017. In addition to the 41 cities, there will be one additional show with a separate lineup in [[Toluca]], Mexico on May 27, 2017 and a "Warped Rewind At Sea" cruise that will sail between [[New Orleans, LA]] and [[Cozumel]], Mexico from October 28 to November 1, 2017.
===Warped Tour 2018=== On November 15, 2017, Kevin Lyman announced that the 2018 Warped Tour will be the final year of operation.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://vanswarpedtour.com/2017/finaltour/|title=Vans Warped Tour|website=Vans Warped Tour|language=en-US|access-date=2017-11-16}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.altpress.com/static/warped_tour_2018_final_dates.html|title=www.altpress.com/static/warped_tour_2018_final_dates.html|website=Alternative Press|language=en|access-date=2017-11-16|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180215123219/https://www.altpress.com/static/warped_tour_2018_final_dates.html#|archive-date=February 15, 2018|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref> "I am so grateful to have worked with more than 1,700 bands over the last 23 summers," Lyman said in his announcement. "I wish I could thank every band that has played the tour."<ref name=":0" /> In addition, Warped Tour announced it would play in Japan for 2018. Headliners for the Japan Version are [[Korn]] (who have never played the festival), [[Prophets of Rage]], and [[Limp Bizkit]] (who appeared at Warped Tour 1997) <ref> http://www.theprp.com/2017/12/15/news/korn-limp-bizkit-prophets-rage-booked-vans-warped-tour-japan/</ref>
==Impact of Warped Tour==
==Legacy==
Warped Tour became a launching pad for many up and coming artists. The festival has been attributed to bringing unknown artists like [[Black Veil Brides]], [[Avenged Sevenfold]], [[Blink-182]], [[Limp Bizkit]], [[My Chemical Romance]], [[Fall Out Boy]], [[Paramore]], [[MGK]], [[Katy Perry]] and [[Yelawolf]] to the spotlight.<ref>Ben-Yehuda, Ayala. "Upfront Latin: Austin Goes Latin." Billboard 8 Mar. 2008: 18. Print.</ref>
The Warped Tour gave artists like [[Will.i.am]] and the [[Black Eyed Peas]] a chance to perform. Black Eyed Peas were featured on the 1999 Vans Warped Tour. According to Will.i.am, the Black Eyed Peas were the first group not categorized as "punk" to play at Warped Tour.<ref>Concepcion, Mariel. "NO E.N.D. TO Success." Billboard 31 July 2010: 25-27. Print.</ref>
== Tours By Year == {{col-begin}} {{col-2}} * Warped Tour 1995 * [[Warped Tour 1996]] * [[Warped Tour 1997]] * [[Warped Tour 1998]] * Warped Tour 1999 * Warped Tour 2000 * Warped Tour 2001 * Warped Tour 2002 * Warped Tour 2003 * Warped Tour 2004 * Warped Tour 2005 * Warped Tour 2006 {{col-2}} * Warped Tour 2007 * Warped Tour 2008 * Warped Tour 2009 * Warped Tour 2010 * Warped Tour 2011 * Warped Tour 2012 * Warped Tour 2013 * Warped Tour 2014 * Warped Tour 2015 * Warped Tour 2016 * [[Warped Tour 2017]] * Warped Tour 2018 {{col-end}}
==Music lessons==
Musicians on the Vans Warped tour gave lessons. Percussive Marketing Council teamed up with the Vans Warped Tour and has given free drum lessons to the concert goers.<ref name="ReferenceB">"Free Drum Lessons at Warped Tour." Music Trades Sept. 2014: 28. Print.</ref> The lessons were given at the Lesson Lab tent. These music lessons are for people who are learning to play drums for the first time.<ref name="ReferenceB"/> The lessons utilized electronic drumsets and acoustic drumsets.<ref name="ReferenceC">Rashidi, Waleed. "BACKBEATS: Street Drum Corps At Warped Tour." Modern Drummer Nov. 2005: 176. Print.</ref> According to PMC Advisory Board Member Billy Cuthrell, having drum teachers from other percussion stores is the "key" to the free lessons program.<ref name="ReferenceB"/>
In 2005, the Vans Warped tour incorporated a multiple level stage that consisted of two levels for the band Street Drum Corps.<ref name="ReferenceC"/>
Music education was a big part of the Vans Warped Tour. Throughout the years, the Warped Tour utilized the John Lennon Bus to achieve this.<ref name=Galante>Block, Debbie Galante. "A Dream Studio on Wheels: Brian Roschild Describes the Vision Behind the Lennon Educational Tour Bus." Billboard 19 May 2007: 34-36. Print.</ref> The John Lennon Bus was started by Ben Roschild and Yoko Ono in 1968.<ref name=Kenny>Kenny, Tom. "Bringing Music to the People." Mix Jan. 2012: 18-20. Print.</ref> The goal of the John Lennon Bus was to educate people about music who attended the Warped Tour. Brian Roschild is the executive director of the John Lennon Bus. Essentially, the John Lennon Bus is a mobile studio. The demographic that the bus is trying to educate is the younger generation. Not only do people from the public participate, but artists do as well. Artists like Eminem and Bowling For Soup have visited the tour bus.<ref name=Galante/> Other celebrities to use the bus include Fergie from the Black Eyed Peas, Natasha Bedingfield, and John Legend.<ref name=Kenny/>
==Battle of the Bands==
The Ernie Ball Battle of the Bands took place at Warped Tour every year. Over 10,000 bands tried out for the battle of the bands in 2005. The bands perform at their local Warped tour date and are judged by professionals from the music industry. If the bands do well in the competition, they get to perform as a side stage act on the Ernie Ball Stage of the Vans Warped Tour.<ref>Molenda, Michael. "Riffs: Ernie Ball's Battle of the Bands 9." Guitar Player Apr. 2006: 46. Print.</ref>
==Criticism and controversy== [[File:Warped Tour merch tents 2010-08-10 04.jpg|right|thumb|Artist, record label, and sponsor tents occupy the central area of the tour stops, selling merchandise and holding autograph signings.]] "Warped Tour is a place for teenage kids to go and hear all their favorite bands in one day," says Rob Pasalic, guitarist for the Saint Alvia Cartel. "It wouldn’t make sense for it to be the same tour in 2007 as it was in 1997. These are the bands that kids like, and the tour is smart enough to grow and adapt to that. You still get bands like [[Bad Religion]] playing, so it’s not like it’s lost all its roots."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://music.aol.ca/article/warped-tour/125/|title=Warped Tour Keeps Skating Straight Ahead|accessdate=August 23, 2007|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110725141733/http://music.aol.ca/article/warped-tour/125/|archivedate=July 25, 2011}}</ref>
[[Joe Queer]] of [[The Queers]] stated that
<blockquote>You play music because there's something inside of you that says you have to play music. Now you get bands like [[Fall Out Boy]] that are basically created in the studio. The Warped Tour changed it. Fuck it. I just don't like that shit. All the guys in the bands remind me of the [[Jock (athlete)|jocks]] I hated in high school. To me a punk gig is a small sweaty club with the audience right in your face knocking over the mic stand and boogying off the energy.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.wirenh.com/music-mainmenu-5/15-music-general/1597-joe-queer-the-face-of-punk.html |title=頭部外傷でお悩みの方へ充実のサポート | 高次脳機能障害は弁護士に相談｜弁護士法人たくみ法律事務所 |website=Wirenh.com |date=2014-06-20 |accessdate=2016-09-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101201233541/http://wirenh.com/music-mainmenu-5/15-music-general/1597-joe-queer-the-face-of-punk.html |archivedate=December 1, 2010 |df=mdy-all }}</ref></blockquote>
[[File:AnberlininPhoenix.jpg|thumb|[[Anberlin]] preparing for a meet-and-greet at the MySpace tent on the 2007 tour. Performers often meet with fans and sign autographs at the various artist and sponsor tents.]]
[[Keith Morris]] has stated "These kids that are on the Warped Tour, they should have no choice but to go into the military, and go off to some desert somewhere and spend some time in the desert, rather than having some big, ultra mega record company giving them lots of money and paying for their hotels and buses, making sure their hair is trendy, and that they are wearing the proper clothes that all the kids like and wear, and all that fun shit."<ref>[http://www.facebook.com/topic.php?uid=9241014431&topic=4111]{{dead link|date=September 2012}}</ref> Morris' band the [[Circle Jerks]] would later appear on the 2007 edition of the tour.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.ultimate-guitar.com/news/upcoming_tours/circle_jerks_to_join_this_years_warped_tour.html |title= Circle Jerks To Join This Year's Warped Tour |date= June 21, 2007 |work= Ultimate-Guitar.com |accessdate=August 11, 2010}}</ref>
In 2013, [[Oliver Sykes]], lead vocalist of [[Bring Me the Horizon]] took to Twitter to pronounce that he was no longer allowed to start a [[mosh pit]] or wall of death. Kevin Lyman took to Twitter as well to say that audience members can create mosh pits and wall of deaths but that someone in the audience has to be the initiator and not a band member because then they are taking responsibility for any injuries which can then lead to costly lawsuits.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.punknews.org/article/52048/warped-tour-act-claims-ban-on-terms-like-mosh-pit-and-wall-of-death |title=Warped Tour act claims ban on terms like "mosh pit" and "wall of death" |publisher=Punknews.org |date=2013-06-24 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.punknews.org/article/52115/warped-tours-kevin-lyman-comments-on-mosh-pit-controversy |title=Warped Tour's Kevin Lyman comments on 'mosh pit' controversy |publisher=Punknews.org |date=2013-06-28 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref>
On July 1, 2015, it was announced that [[Front Porch Step]] would be playing the Nashville, TN tour stop,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.altpress.com/news/entry/musicians_react_to_front_porch_step_playing_warped_tour |title=Musicians react to Front Porch Step playing Warped Tour - News - Alternative Press |publisher=Altpress.com |date=2015-07-01 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.altpress.com/news/entry/front_porch_step_reportedly_playing_warped_tour_today |title=Front Porch Step reportedly playing Warped Tour today - UPDATED - News - Alternative Press |publisher=Altpress.com |date=2015-07-01 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> despite allegedly sexually harassing numerous young girls through explicit text messages, nude photographs, and phone sex.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.altpress.com/news/entry/everything_we_know_about_the_sexual_harassment_allegations_against_front_po |title=Everything we know about the sexual harassment allegations against Front Porch Step - News - Alternative Press |publisher=Altpress.com |date=2015-01-01 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> Many bands, including [[The Wonder Years (band)|The Wonder Years]], [[Senses Fail]], [[Handguns]], and [[Beartooth (band)|Beartooth]] asked attendees to not go to McElfresh's set. The Wonder Years' lead singer Dan “Soupy” Campbell, who was supposed to perform after Front Porch Step on the Acoustic Basement Stage, asked fans to go see [[Man Overboard (band)|Man Overboard]] at 1:15pm, the time the acoustic set would take place.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/4mXWkenLqB/ |title=Instagram |publisher=Instagram |date=2015-07-01 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> Lyman responded by saying,
<blockquote>He was only supposed to be here long enough to play his show but the weather today has been putting us behind schedule. He wasn't added to the tour, so those claims that he was ‘added to sell tickets’ are completely groundless.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.altpress.com/news/entry/warped_tours_kevin_lyman_responds_to_front_porch_step_controversy_exclusive |title=Warped Tour’s Kevin Lyman responds to Front Porch Step controversy (exclusive) - News - Alternative Press |website=Altpress.com |date=2015-07-01 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref></blockquote>
He also said because McElfresh had still not been formally charged with any misconduct, he agreed to have him perform. "If he was a danger to anyone, he simply would not have been here."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.altpress.com/news/entry/warped_tours_kevin_lyman_responds_to_front_porch_step_controversy_exclusive |title=Warped Tour’s Kevin Lyman responds to Front Porch Step controversy (exclusive) - News - Alternative Press |publisher=Altpress.com |date=2015-07-01 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref>
On July 11, 2016, Vans Warped Tour announced that Virginia pro-life organization [[Students for Life of America|Rock For Life]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://studentsforlife.org/national-summer-rock-for-life-tour-kicks-off/|title=National Summer Rock For Life Tour Kicks Off|publisher=Students for Life of America|date=2016-06-01|accessdate=2017-11-21}}</ref> would be one of the vendors on their 41 tour dates. Rock For Life are known for co-opting punk aesthetics with their logo of a fetus playing a guitar, T-shirts with the phrase “All Lives Matter”.<ref>{{cite web |author=July 11, 2016 |url=http://www.aux.tv/2016/07/vans-warped-tour-draws-controversy-for-its-pro-life-tent/ |title=Vans Warped Tour draws controversy for its pro-life tent |publisher=AUX.TV |date=2016-07-11 |accessdate=2016-09-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160813032921/http://www.aux.tv/2016/07/vans-warped-tour-draws-controversy-for-its-pro-life-tent/ |archive-date=August 13, 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Bands such as Safe To Say<ref name="twitter1">{{cite tweet|user=safetosaymusic|author=SAFETOSAY|number=763823506664587264|date=11 August 2016|title=Yes. Everyday. We are a pro choice band. A tent telling young women what to do with their body has no place here.}}</ref> and Old Wounds<ref>{{cite tweet|user=oldwoundsnj|author=OLD WOUNDS|number=763810457563955200|date=11 August 2016|title=@rockforlife @realfriendsband @safetosaymusic @Cruelhandhc yeah and so did we.}}</ref> have spoken out against the organization, with Safe To Say, replying to Rock For Life's tweet, saying
<blockquote>Yes. Everyday. We are a pro choice band. A tent telling young women what to do with their body has no place here.<ref name="twitter1"/></blockquote>
On June 26, 2017, a video surfaced of the punk rock band [[The Dickies]] verbally abusing a crowd member after protests against the band, including signs that said "Our teenage girls don't need to be subjected to derogatory jokes by a disgusting old man" and "Punk isn't predatory" took place.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rocksound.tv/news/read/a-warped-tour-band-have-been-criticised-for-inappropriate-behaviour|title=Former Warped Tour Band Verbally Abuses Crowd Member, Warped Tour Founder Kevin Lyman Responds - News - Rock Sound Magazine|website=Rock Sound Magazine|accessdate=September 1, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://exclaim.ca/music/article/everyones_mad_at_the_dickies_after_they_verbally_abused_a_warped_tour_attendee|title=Everyone's Mad at the Dickies After They Verbally Abused a Warped Tour Attendee|publisher=|accessdate=September 1, 2017}}</ref> While Lyman did initially say that the band was no longer on the Warped Tour roster,<ref>{{cite tweet|user=KevinLyman|author=KevinLyman|number=879430678173155328|date=26 June 2017|title=@johnothetree It was a very unfortunate incident and the tour does not condone this at all, they will no longer be on the tour.}}</ref> he released a statement on July 1 that said the band was not kicked off of the tour and that the altercation was between the band's frontman, Leonard Graves Phillips, and a member of the touring party.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rocksound.tv/news/read/vans-warped-tour-founder-kevin-lyman-speaks-out-about-the-dickies-verbal-ab|title=Vans Warped Tour Founder Kevin Lyman Speaks Out About The Dickies Verbal Abuse Incident - News - Rock Sound Magazine|website=Rock Sound Magazine|accessdate=September 1, 2017}}</ref>
<blockquote>I thought it was time to put the facts out since I have watched false information floating around. A video has been circulating of a confrontation between Leonard from the Dickies and a Fan. Fact- it was not a Fan, but a member of the touring party. The member of the touring party was standing next to the PA with a sign protesting some of the things they found offensive about the bands jokes, and props on stage. During one of the last songs they went towards the barricade and directed the sign at the band. After a verbal barrage from Leonard, the member of the touring party threw the sign at Leonard, and left the area. I do not condone verbal or physical violence, whatsoever. The Dickies, last day of the tour was that Sunday, which had always been scheduled. These are the facts of what took place and this is why I ask anyone who has an issue with anyone else on tour, to come sit under my tent with me and express their views diplomatically. On this years tour we have many people who may not agree with each other, but as humans we should be able to express our points of view in a civil manner. If we have any hope to progress as a society, communication will be key in moving forward.<ref name="Rocksound"/></blockquote>
===Band conflicts=== [[File:Warped Tour half-pipe 2010-08-10.jpg|right|thumb|Athletes perform exhibitions of skateboarding, BMX biking, and other sports on [[half-pipe]]s and other ramps during the tour. Attendees are often also permitted to participate.]] A few bands have left the tour due to conflicts they had with the tour or with other bands:
* Both [[D12]] and [[Esham]] were kicked out of the 2001 tour. D12 allegedly attacked Esham because he mentioned [[Eminem]]'s daughter in his song "Chemical Imbalance". Eminem was not present.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.dailybruin.com/index.php/article/2001/08/rappers-esham-d12-kicked-off-w |title=Rappers Esham, D12 kicked off Warped Tour after alleged attack |publisher=Daily Bruin |date=2001-08-12 |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref> * The band [[Guttermouth]] was supposedly removed from the [[Warped Tour 2004]] for insulting [[Simple Plan]]. The band later stated that they left themselves due to "that '10 or so' unnamed bands didn't jive with [[Guttermouth]]'s way of doing business, and in some cases, threatened them with violence".<ref>[http://www.aversion.com/news/news_article.cfm?news_id=2782] {{dead link|date=September 2016}}</ref> *The band Islander was kicked off the tour after Mikey Carvajal jumping into a backline drum kit onstage and damaging it during their live set in Denver on July 1st.
===Sponsorship=== The Vans Warped Tour was sponsored by Vans, and in the final years Journeys joined as sponsor. Kevin Lyman was offered sponsorship from Calvin Klein before eventually working with Vans.<ref name=Whitmire>Whitmire, Margo. "Music: Touring-Warped Success Based on Selective Sponsorship." Billboard 20 Nov. 2004: 20. Print.</ref> The tour also was sponsored by Samsung, which allowed the bands and fans to interact with one another. The schedule for the day was sent out to the fans the day of their show. Samsung also sponsored a reverse day care for the Warped tour, which allows parents to cool off and their children to watch their favorite bands.<ref name=Whitmire/> Warped Tour also partnered with other technology companies like Cingular Wireless, Apple Computer and many others.<ref name=Banerjee>Banerjee, Scott. "Warped Wins Tech Sponsors: Cingular, Samsung, Others Sign On." Billboard 31 July 2004: 43+. Print.</ref> This allows these companies to reach to younger audiences. The communications manager from Memorex stated that Warped Tour allows them to reach a younger demographic due because of the music that these people are "passionate about."<ref name=Banerjee/> At one point in time, Warped Tour also provided the attendees internet service while at the festival. Chaos Mobile was formed by Kevin Lyman and John Reese of Freeze Artist Management.<ref>Bruno, Antony. "Digital Entertainment: Mogul- Mobile-Chaos Theory." Billboard 18 Nov. 2006: 16. Print.</ref>
===Activism=== Activism was a major component of the Vans Warped Tour. Warped Tour allowed for non-profit organizations such as Invisible Children, [[To Write Love On Her Arms]], Shirts for a Cure, [[Keep A Breast Foundation]], and [[Hope For The Day]] to advocate about their cause.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://thewilsonbillboard.com/2018/08/farewell-warped-tour-1995-2018-its-okay-not-to-be-okay/|title=Farewell, Warped Tour (1995-2018): “It’s Okay Not to be Okay”|website=thewilsonbillboard.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-23}}</ref> Other causes that were represented at Warped Tour were [[Music Saves Lives]] and Earth Echo. Earth Echo promotes recycling. They also provide a solar powered stage.<ref name=Waddell>Waddell, Ray. "On the Road: Vans Warped Tour Founder Honored." Billboard 7 Nov. 2009: 54. Print.</ref> Keep A Breast is another organization on the Vans Warped Tour. Keep A Breast educates women about Breast Cancer and preventative measures against the disease. This organization worked in conjunction with the Girlz Garage on the Vans Warped Tour. People who donate to the cause are given T-shirts signed by artists on the tour to spread awareness of Breast Cancer.<ref>"Good Works." Billboard 7 July 2007: 93. Print.</ref>
In March 2016, it was announced that Warped Tour would be teaming up with A Voice For The Innocent to address the issue of sex crimes in the music scene.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.avoicefortheinnocent.org |title=Home |publisher=A Voice For The Innocent |date= |accessdate=2016-09-24}}</ref>
===Philanthropy===
The Vans Warped Tour contributed 25 cents from every ticket sold to an organization called Hollywood Heart. Warped Tour also gave money to the relief efforts for Hurricane Katrina. Warped Tour and the Taste of Chaos, (a festival) worked together to contribute $500,000<ref name=Waddell/>
===Musical equipment===
The bands on the Warped Tour often brought their own musical equipment. However, Industrial Sound also provided equipment for bands to use while on the Vans Warped Tour. Daniel Bonneau, the lead sound engineer, stated that Industrial Sound is a company that he "relies" on to provide equipment for the festival. Bonneau also states that the bands are not able to do traditional soundchecks and bands have to do line checks.<ref name=Billboard>Benzuly, Sarah, and Breean Lingle. "Vans Warped Tour". ''Billboard'' Sept. 2003: 76–77. Print.</ref>
==Official compilation albums== [[File:Pennywise Warped Tour.jpg|right|thumb|[[Pennywise (band)|Pennywise]] performed on 8 of the first 16 Warped Tours.]] [[File:Warped Tour moshing 2010-08-10 03.jpg|right|thumb|Attendees [[moshing]] in a circle pit on the 2010 tour.]] An official Warped Tour compilation CD was released annually by [[SideOneDummy Records]] to coincide with the start of the tour. Prior to 1998 the official releases were handled by Vans via Uni Distribution in 1996 and [[Epitaph Records]] in 1997 respectively. The compilation included songs by numerous artists performing on the tour that year. The first few compilations had varying titles, but since 2001 the series has used a standard title with the format "Warped Tour <year> Tour Compilation." In 2002 the compilation expanded onto 2 CDs totalling 50 artists, a format which the series has followed in all subsequent years. The Warped Tour compilation album in 2002 charted at number 55.<ref>Mayfield, Geoff. "Over the Counter: Fondly Remembered." Billboard 26 June 2004: 82. Print.</ref>
{| class="wikitable" |- !Year !Title |- |1996 |''Vans Warped Music Sampler 1996'' |- |1997 |''[[Punk-O-Rama Vol. 2|Vans Warped Tour '97 Presents Punk-O-Rama Vol. 2.1]]'' |- |1998 |''A Compilation of Warped Music'' |- |1999 |''A Compilation of Warped Music II'' |- |2000 |''World Warped III Live'' |- |2001 |''Warped Tour 2001 Tour Compilation'' |- |2002 |''Warped Tour 2002 Tour Compilation'' |- |2003 |''Warped Tour 2003 Tour Compilation'' |- |2004 |''Warped Tour 2004 Tour Compilation'' |- |2005 |''Warped Tour 2005 Tour Compilation'' |- |2006 |''Warped Tour 2006 Tour Compilation'' |- |2007 |''Warped Tour 2007 Tour Compilation'' |- |2008 |''Warped Tour 2008 Tour Compilation'' |- |2009 |''Warped Tour 2009 Tour Compilation'' |- |2010 |''Warped Tour 2010 Tour Compilation'' |- |2011 |''Warped Tour 2011 Tour Compilation'' |- |2012 |''Warped Tour 2012 Tour Compilation'' |- |2013 |''Warped Tour 2013 Tour Compilation'' |- |2014 |''Warped Tour 2014 Tour Compilation'' |- |2015 |''Warped Tour 2015 Tour Compilation'' |- |2016 |''Warped Tour 2016 Tour Compilation'' |- |2017 |''Warped Tour 2017 Tour Compilation'' |- |2018 |''Warped Tour 2018 Tour Compilation'' |}
In addition, the digital music service [[Rhapsody (online music service)|Rhapsody.com]] released a regular "Warped Tour Bootleg Series," with each entry focusing on a single artists performing on the tour. Past Bootleg Series artists have included [[Matchbook Romance]], [[My Chemical Romance]], [[Bedouin Soundclash]], [[MxPx]], [[The Starting Line]], [[Millencolin]], [[Avenged Sevenfold]], [[Gogol Bordello]], [[Motion City Soundtrack]], [[The Casualties]], [[Anti-Flag]], [[Less Than Jake]], [[Rise Against]], [[Joan Jett & The Blackhearts]], [[Helmet (band)|Helmet]], and [[The Academy Is...]].
